quotes.text: No one here gets out alive.

quotes.text: Embrace the probability of your imminent death....and know there is nothing i can do to save you.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.text: No man should go to Valhalla with brothel rash.

quotes.text: We're reaching for death on the end of a candle We're trying for something that's already found us
quotes.author: jim morrison

quotes.text: Tell her thisAnd more,'”That the king of the seasWeeps too, old, helpless man.The bustling fatesHeap his hands with corpsesUntil he stands like a childWith surplus of toys.

quotes.text: I wonder if it will rain after we die. When you kill yourself, you don't know what happens next, afterward.

quotes.text: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.

quotes.text: Woe, destruction, ruin, and decay; the worst is death and death will have his day.

quotes.text: In every person, there is a doer and a devil. With every passing days, the doer dies and a devil has to rise.

quotes.text: Everyone facing death, especially premature death, like us, will be kicking themselves about each wasted hour.
quotes.author: Hans Fallada

quotes.text: Some things are private. Some things needed to be said, even when the person who needed to hear them couldn't hear anything. Ever again.

quotes.text: But at my back I always hear Time's wingÃƒ¨d chariot hurrying near

quotes.text: Death is harder on those who are left behind.

quotes.text: Death is woven in with the violets,' said Louis. 'œDeath and again death.')

quotes.text: Each child's story is worthy of telling. There shouldn't be a sliding scale of death. The weight of it is crushing.

quotes.text: The scribbled signature black, onto the blinding global white, onto the thick soupy red.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: We'd stared into the face of Death, and Death blinked first. You'd think that would make us feel brave and invincible. It didn't.

quotes.text: But now, as it is, sorrows, unending sorrows must surge within your heart as well'”for your own son's death. Never again will you embrace him stiding home. My spirit rebels'”I've lost the will to live, to take my stand in the world of men'”
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.text: For the first time in my life I tasted death, and death tasted bitter, for death is birth, is fear and dread of some terrible renewal.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

quotes.text: Death is perfectly safe. (55)

quotes.text: I think people would live a bit longer if they didn't know how old they were. Age puts restrictions on things.

quotes.text: Here the whole world (stars, water, air,And field, and forest, as they wereReflected in a single mind)Like cast off clothes was left behindIn ashes, yet with hopes that she,Re-born from holy poverty,In lenten lands, hereafter mayResume them on her Easter Day."(Epitaph for Joy Davidman)

quotes.text: Does anyone else day dream about what it would be like if specific age groups just dropped dead all across the world?

quotes.text: REQUIEMUnder the wide and starry skyDig the grave and let me lie:Glad did I live and gladly die,And I laid me down with a will.This be the verse you grave for me:Here he lies where he long'd to be;Home is the sailor, home from the sea,And the hunter home from the hill.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: I looked at the stained-glass image of the lamb in the window above me, but that only reminded me that lambs are famous for being led to slaughter, or sometimes hanging out with lions in ill-advised relationships.

quotes.text: The day of my birth, my death began its walk. It is walking toward me, without hurrying.

quotes.text: Dark circles under my eyes sink deeper and deeper into my skull, in contrast to my pale skin there is an undeniable resemblance to a fresh corpse.

quotes.text: Death is contagious; it is contracted the moment we are conceived.

quotes.text: But there is nothing in biology yet found that indicates the inevitability of death.

quotes.text: Awareness is everything. Hallie once pointed out to me that people worry a lot more about the eternity *after* their deaths than the eternity that happened before they were born. But it's the same amount of infinity, rolling out in all directions from where we stand.

quotes.text: When your people are lying dead around you, don't come crying to me...
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.text: '¦the longer I think about it the more it seems to me that we who are still alive are unreal in the eyes of the dead, that only occasionally, in certain lights and atmospheric conditions, do we appear in their field of vision.

quotes.text: In so many senseless deaths, beauty is to blame.
quotes.author: Suzanne Finnamore

quotes.text: The only true borders lie between day and night, between life and death, between hope and loss.

quotes.text: Plants are more courageous than almost all human beings: an orange tree would rather die than produce lemons, whereas instead of dying the average person would rather be someone they are not.

quotes.text: This is the secret that none dares tell who fights for a cause. Dying, we are all alike.

quotes.text: I never wanted to go away, and the hard part now is the leaving you all. I'm not afraid, but it seems as if I should be homesick for you even in heaven.

quotes.text: Loneliness is the standard that separates life from death.

quotes.text: I've got death inside me. It's just a question of whether or not I can outlive it.

quotes.text: It's harder to pick and choose when you're dead. It's like a photograph, you know. It doesn't matter as much.

quotes.text: Full fathom five thy father lies;Of his bones are coral made;Those are pearls that were his eyes:Nothing of him that doth fade,But doth suffer a sea-changeInto something rich and strange.Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell: Ding-dong Hark! now I hear them,'”Ding-dong, bell.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: But thy strong Hours indignant work'd their wills,And beat me down and marr'd and wasted me,And tho' they could not end me, left me maim'dTo dwell in presence of immortal youth,Immortal age beside immortal youth,And all I was, in ashes. - Tithonus
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.text: But she wasn't around, and that's the thing when your parents die, you feel like instead of going in to every fight with backup, you are going into every fight alone.

quotes.text: Because the plan God has for each of our lives isn't always the same plan we have for ourselves, Grace. Sometimes, our deaths have more of an impact than our births. It can inspire people to do great things, even greater than they would have had the deaths not happened at all.
quotes.author: S.L. Naeole

quotes.text: Leonard asks me if there's anything I need to know before he dies, I think about it for a minute, turn to him, say what's the meaning of life, Leonard? He laughs, says that's an easy one, my son, it's whatever you want it to be.

quotes.text: At the end of the day your ability to connect with your readers comes down to how you make them feel.
quotes.author: Benjamin J. Carey

quotes.text: My love, do you recall the object which we saw,That fair, sweet, summer morn!At a turn in the path a foul carcassOn a gravel strewn bed,Its legs raised in the air, like a lustful woman,Burning and dripping with poisons,Displayed in a shameless, nonchalant wayIts belly, swollen with gases.- A Carcass
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.text: Time moves on for us, for you it stands still. You will be forever ageless as we grow old, your smile will never wrinkle, nor will that shine in your eyes fade..

quotes.text: That which has died falls not out of the universe. If it stays here, it also changes here, and is dissolved into its proper parts, which are elements of the universe and of thyself. And these too change, and they murmur not".

quotes.text: Life is a long agonized illness only curable by death.
quotes.author: Spike Milligan

quotes.text: What if she's all I give you in this life of ours, my love?" she asked quietly. "Then I'll shout at the goddess in fury," he said fiercely. "I'll beg to know why I've been given so much when other men have so little.

quotes.text: I'll never speak to God again.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: With that, I took a deep breath and leapt; spreading my arms, pretending I could fly . . .

quotes.text: O, never from the memory of my heartYour dear, paternal image shall depart,Who while on earth, ere yet by death surprised,Taught me how mortals are immortalized;How grateful am I for that patient careAll my life long my language shall declare.

quotes.text: The calla lilies are in bloom again. Such a strange flower'”suitable to any occasion. I carried them on my wedding day, and now I place them here in memory of something that has died.

quotes.text: Tell your friend that in his death, a part of you dies and goes with him. Wherever he goes, you also go. He will not be alone.

quotes.text: What I have learned lately is that people deal with death in all sorts of ways. Some of us fight against it, doing everything we can to make it not true. Some of us lose our selves to grief. Some of us lose ourselves to anger.

quotes.text: You do not immortalize the lost by writing about them. Language buries, but does not resurrect.

quotes.text: I felt the unfairness of it, the inarguable injustice of loving someone who might have loved you back but can't due to deadness.

quotes.text: That's all you can do in this world, no matter how strong the current beats against you, or how heavy your burden, or how tragic your love story. You keep going.

quotes.text: I would have had to kill him, and Death, you know, keeps secrets better even than a guilty Roman.

quotes.text: When we die, we will turn into songs, and we will hear each other and remember each other.

quotes.text: But on paper, things can live forever. On paper, a butterfly never dies.

quotes.text: She had storms all her life, but she died peacefully.

quotes.text: In my kind of falling, there's no landing. There's only hitting the ground. Hard. Dead, or wanting to be dead. So the whole time you're falling, it's the worst feeling in the world. Because you feel you have no control over it. Because you know how it ends.
quotes.author: David Levithan

quotes.text: There are three deaths. The first is when the body ceases to function. The second is when the body is consigned to the grave. The third is that moment, sometime in the future, when your name is spoken for the last time.

quotes.text: The reason they invented coffins, to lock the dead in, preserve them, they put makeup on them; they didn't want them spreading or changing into anything else. The stone with the name and date was on them to weight them down.

quotes.text: Everything science has taught me strengthens my belief in the continuity of our spiritual existence after death. I believe in an immortal soul. Science has proved that nothing disintegrates into nothingness. Life and soul, therefore, cannot disintegrate into nothingness, and so are immortal.
quotes.author: Werner Von Braun

quotes.text: well, death says, as he walks by, I'm going to get you anyhow no matter what you've been: writer, cab-driver, pimp, butcher, sky-diver, I'm going to get you

quotes.text: But unless we determine to take action,' said the old man querulously, as if struggling against something deeply insouciant in his nature, 'then we shall all be destroyed, we shall all die. Surely we care about that?' 'Not enough to want to get killed over it,' said Ford.

quotes.text: Our planet is poorly equipped for delight.One must snatch gladness from the days that are.In this lifeit's not difficult to die.To make lifeis more difficult by far.

quotes.text: In life, more than in anything else, it isn't easy to end up alive.

quotes.text: An enemy is like a man's most prized flower. It brings him joy to see it buried in the ground.

quotes.text: The fact that life has no meaning is a reason to live --moreover, the only one.

quotes.text: The reaper does not listen to the harvest.

quotes.text: Nothing can dwindle to nothing, as Nature restores one thing from the stuff of another, nor does she allow a birth, without a corresponding death.

quotes.text: Maybe before you die, it's your ghosts you see.

quotes.text: Death should take me while I am in the mood.

quotes.text: I not afraid of dying, I'm afraid of suffering

quotes.text: You may say suicide is a loss of control and cowardly. Foolish as it may sound, I am prepared to argue.

quotes.text: But a kingdom that has once been destroyed can never come again into being; nor can the dead ever be brought back to life.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: J'Ãƒ©coutais mon cÃ…“ur. Je ne pouvais imaginer que ce bruit qui m'accompagnait depuis si longtemps pÃƒ»t jamais cesser.

quotes.text: Corpses sour you. They are bad for objectivity.

quotes.text: You have tasted of death now,' said the old man. 'œIs it good?' 'œIt is good,' said Mossy. 'œIt is better than life.''œNo,' said the old man: 'œit is only more life.

quotes.text: Are not our lives too short for that full utterance which through all our stammerings is of course our only and abiding intention?

quotes.text: So death, the most terrifying of ills, is nothing to us, since so long as we exist, death is not with us; but when death comes, then we do not exist. It does not then concern either the living or the dead, since for the former it is not, and the latter are no more.

quotes.text: I wish I had a memory of that first violent shove, the shock of cold air, the sting of oxygen into new lungs. Everyone should remember being born. It doesn't seem fair that we only remember dying.

quotes.author: Stephanie PearlMcPhee

quotes.text: There are times when I'm doing QI and I'm going, 'Ha ha, yeah, yeah,' and inside I'm going 'I want to fucking die. I '¦ want '¦ to '¦ fucking '¦ die.'(Source : RHLSTP #18 - @87min32s)

quotes.text: If they tell you that she died of sleeping pills you must know that she died of a wasting grief, of a slow bleeding at the soul.
quotes.author: Clifford Odets

quotes.text: We understand death for the first time when he puts his hand upon one whom we love

quotes.text: Could she smell my breath? Could she hear my cursed circular heart beat revolving like the crime it is in my deathly chest?
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: When we see death, we see disaster. When Jesus sees death, he sees deliverance!

quotes.text: If we knew what we are, we should do as Sir Arthur Jermyn did; and Arthur Jermyn soaked himself in oil and set first to his clothing one night.
quotes.author: H.P. Lovecraft

quotes.text: A los mortales os hace falta compaÃƒ±Ãƒ­a porque tenÃƒ©is tristeza, deseos y un tiempo limitado de vida.
quotes.author: Jackson Pearce

quotes.text: Please don't die.
quotes.author: Randy Pausch

quotes.text: I basked in you;I loved you, helplessly, with a boundless tongue-tied love.And death doesn't prevent me from loving you.Besides, in my opinion you aren't dead.(I know dead people, and you are not dead.)
quotes.author: Franz Wright

quotes.text: Not success. Not growth. Not happiness. The cradle of your love of life '¦ is death.
quotes.author: Stephen Jenkinson

quotes.text: I'm not afraid to die. What I'm afraid of is having reality get the better of me, of having reality leave me behind.

quotes.text: No,' Nico said. '˜Getting a second life is one thing. Making it a better life, that's the trick.' As soon as he said it, Nico realized he could've been talking about himself. He decided not to bring that up.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.text: The trouble about jumping was that if you didn't pick the right number of storeys, you might still be alive when you hit bottom.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.text: Can there be anything more sad than a girl dying on the day of her first communion, in her new dress. A little bride of death...
quotes.author: Georges Rodenbach

quotes.text: It was a year for the ages, like 79, like 1346, to name just a few. Forget the scythe, Goddamn it, I needed a broom or a mop. And I needed a vacation.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: How talented was death. How many expressions and manipulations of hand, face, body, no two alike.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous possessive love that grabs at what it can.
quotes.author: Yann Martel

quotes.text: Life is here, death is over there. I am here, not over there.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: Death, like a host, comes smiling to the door;Smiling, he greets us, on that tranquil shoreWhere neither piping bird nor peeping dawnDisturbs the eternal sleep,But in the stillness far withdrawnOur dreamless rest for evermore we keep.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: Death is inevitable passion is eternal
quotes.author: Allison van Diepen

quotes.text: Our essence is change. We are movement. Being out of balance is life. Perfect balance. Stasis. That is death. Life yearns for perfection. Death is perfection.
quotes.author: Chris Boucher

quotes.text: How fortunate we were who still had hope I did not then realise; I could not know how soon the time would come when we should have no more hope, and yet be unable to die
quotes.author: Vera Brittain

quotes.text: By daily dying, I have come to be.
quotes.author: Theodore Roethke

quotes.text: Sin, death, and hell have set their marks on him,And all their ministers attend on him.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Glory is the sunshine of the dead
quotes.author: HonorÃƒÂ© de Balzac

quotes.text: Funerals aren't scheduled.
quotes.author: Benjamin J. Carey

quotes.text: He said that we belonged together because he was born with a flower and I was born with a butterfly and that flowers and butterflies need each other for survival.

quotes.text: The day you were born the angels whispered, "She is going to love him until the day she dies.
quotes.author: Amanda Mosher

quotes.text: Some years later, long after he and Megadeth parted company, Jay Jones was stabbed to death with a butter knife during-rumor has it-a fight over a bolonga sandwich. That's not funny, of course. But, if you knew Jay, neither is it particularly suprising.
quotes.author: Dave Mustaine

quotes.text: Here is one of the worst things about having someone you love die: It happens again every single morning.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.text: Life is a predicament which precedes death.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.text: Smiling at death seems like a pretty bold act. And so I smile like a damned fool.
quotes.author: Emm Cole

quotes.text: Darkling I listen; and, for many a timeI have been half in love with easeful Death...
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.text: There was a roaring in my ears and I lost track of what they were saying. I believe it was the physical manifestation of unbearable grief.
quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.text: The first time I died, I didn't see God. No light at the end of the tunnel. No haloed angels. No dead grandparents. To be fair, I probably wasn't a solid shoo-in for Heaven. But, honestly, I kind of assumed I'd make the cut.
quotes.author: Megan Miranda

quotes.text: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living.
quotes.author: Jo Nesbo

quotes.text: Usually the things that kill us are the things we do every single day.
quotes.author: J. M. McDermott

quotes.text: When death speaks to me, it speaks only of the beauty of life.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.text: Death is alive, they whispered. Death lives inside life, as bones dance within the body. Yesterday is within today. Yesterday never dies.
quotes.author: Luis Alberto Urrea

quotes.text: Two turtle doves will show theeWhere my cold ashes lieAnd sadly murmuring tell theeHow in tears I did die
quotes.author: Nikolai Gogol

quotes.text: Belief in immortality is harmful because it is not in our power to conceive of the soul as really incorporeal. So this belief is in fact a belief in the prolongation of life, and it robs death of its purpose.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.text: We have long become overgrown with calluses; we no longer hear people being killed. ("X")
quotes.author: Yevgeny Zamyatin

quotes.text: I want you here. I don't care if it's a hundred degrees and every blade of grass dies. Without you, none of that matters to me.
quotes.author: Kami Garcia

quotes.text: Wouldn't the joys of life lose all colour, if life was eternal?
quotes.author: Constantina Maud

quotes.text: Failures plagued me. Things I had omitted or ignored, neglected. What I should have given and hadn't. I felt the biting pang of every unfulfillment.
quotes.author: Richard Matheson

quotes.text: Dying is an art.Like everything else,I do it exceptionally well.I do it so it feels like hell.I do it so it feels real.I guess you could say I have a call.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Each day death corrodes what we call living, and life ceaselessly swallows our desire for the void.
quotes.author: Jindrich Styrsky

quotes.text: I carry death in my left pocket. Sometimes I take it out and talk to it: "Hello, baby, how you doing? When you coming for me? I'll be ready.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: He gave her a bright fake smile; so much of life was a putting off of unhappiness for another time. Nothing was ever lost by delay. He had a dim idea that perhaps if one delayed long enough, things were taken out of one's hands altogether by death.
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.text: Ah, Lalage! while life is ours, Hoard not thy beauty rose and white, But pluck the pretty fleeing flowers That deck our little path of light: For all too soon we twain shall tread The bitter pastures of the dead: Estranged, sad spectres of the night.
quotes.author: Ernest Dowson

quotes.text: Just consider how terrible the day of your death will beOthers will go on speaking and you will not be able to argue back
quotes.author: Ram Mohan Roy

quotes.text: I don't know much more than I did when I was alive. Most of the stuff I know now that I didn't know then I can't put into words.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: Susannah continued. "If and when I go off slow dancing in the ever after, I don't want to look like I've been stuck in a hospital room my whole life. I at least want to be tan.
quotes.author: Jenny Han

quotes.text: the gods play nofavorites.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: I believe that to be the world's greatest livingwriterthere must be somethingterribly wrong with you.I don't even want to be the world's greatestdead writer.just being dead would be fairenough.
quotes.author: charles bukowski

quotes.text: ...and there you have it, another body on the floor surrounded by things that don't mean much to anyone except to the one who can't take any of them along.
quotes.author: Mark Z. Danielewski

quotes.text: The thing about oracles is that they talk back.
quotes.author: Darin Bradley

quotes.text: Like they just wanted to enjoy The Gus Waters Show while it was still in town.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: Whenever I see an ambulance, I like to think there is a baby being born, rather than a death.
quotes.author: Phil Lester

quotes.text: That is death - shifting from "is" to "was.
quotes.author: Veronica Roth

quotes.text: Farewell is said by the living, in life, every day. It is said with love and friendship, with the affirmation that the memories are lasting if the flesh is not.
quotes.author: R.A. Salvatore

quotes.text: Quoting son, Noah Levine: Once you see what the heart really needs, it doesn't matter if you're going to live or die, the work is always the same. (25)
quotes.author: Stephen Levine

quotes.text: Let me tell you something about dying: it's not as bad as they says.it's the coming-back-to-life part that hurts.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver

quotes.text: [...] death follows us around for a reason. It's because death is our best adviser. There is nothing more powerful than a person who is prepared to live right now, in this instant, fully accepting that this may be their last moment on earth.
quotes.author: A.C. Ping

quotes.text: How do you tell if something's alive? You check for breathing.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Oh, we do not understand death, we never understand it; creatures are only truly dead when everyone else has died who knew them.
quotes.author: Arthur Schnitzler

quotes.text: No truth can cure the sorrow we feel from losing a loved one. No truth, no sincerity, no strength, no kindness can cure that sorrow. All we can do is see it through to the end and learn something from it, but what we learn will be no help in facing the next sorrow that comes to us without warning.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: Every soldier in the course of time exists only in the breath of written word.
quotes.author: Ivan Doig

quotes.text: Our lives can't be measured by our final years, of this I am sure.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.text: What I wanted to express very clearly and intensely was that the reason these people had to invent or imagine heroes and gods is pure fear. Fear of life and fear of death.
quotes.author: Frida Kahlo

quotes.text: Seems like everything lead up to this dayand it's just like every day that's ever been.Sun goin' up and then the sunit goin' down.
quotes.author: Jerry Garcia

quotes.text: Death is an inevitability, isn't it? You become more aware of that when you get to my age. I don't worry about it. I'm ready for it. When I go, I want to go doing what I do best. If I died tomorrow, I couldn't complain. It's been good.
quotes.author: Lemmy Kilmister

quotes.text: Nobody seems to understand that in such matters the tact and sympathy should come from the one who is about to die, not the poor bugger who has to take the news.
quotes.author: Stephen Fry

quotes.text: Dying for love might be pitiable, but it wasn't much different, finally, from any other kind of dying.
quotes.author: Richard Yates

quotes.text: Death doesn't care about personalities - he's more interested in meeting quotas.
quotes.author: Jasper Fforde

quotes.text: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: It's your life, not your death, that defines you.
quotes.author: J.J. Brown

quotes.text: Mendacity is a system that we live in," declares Brick. "Liquor is one way out an'death's the other.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.text: Life is short, death is forever.
quotes.author: Marsha Qualey

quotes.text: If seeing her an hour before her lastWeak cough into all blackness I could yetBe held by chalk-white walls- The Consumptive. Belsen 1945
quotes.author: Mervyn Peake

quotes.text: Death. It was something I had to think about once. Weird, right? Strange that death was ever an inevitable end, but it wasn't anymore. Not really. I eluded it. Tricked it. It was an odd concept'”the world aged, moved forward, yet I . . . didn't.
quotes.author: Laura Kreitzer

quotes.text: Like as the waves make towards the pebbled shore,So do our minutes hasten to their end;Each changing place with that which goes before,In sequent toil all forwards do contend.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Death alone gives meaning to life, and you will never fully live until you know you must die. And make your peace with that knowledge.
quotes.author: Alice Borchardt

quotes.text: When they write my obituary. Tomorrow. Or the next day. It will say, Leo Gursky is survived by an apartment full of shit
quotes.author: Nicole Krauss

quotes.text: Life's a queue of small irritations with the Last Door at the end.
quotes.author: Joe Abercrombie

quotes.text: Life is just a short period of time in which you are alive.
quotes.author: Philip Roth

quotes.text: Does it hurt?" The childish question had escaped Harry's lips before he could stop it. "Dying? Not at all," said Sirius. "Quicker and easier than falling asleep.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: You ask 'Are you a man or a demon?' Neither, I say. I have woken up, and the rest of you are sleeping, and that is the only difference between us.
quotes.author: Aravind Adiga

quotes.text: Death is as unexpected in his caprice as a courtesan in her disdain; but death is truer '“ Death has never forsaken any man
quotes.author: Honore de Balzac

quotes.text: How unhappy does one have to be before living seems worse than dying?
quotes.author: Deborah Curtis

quotes.text: We tend to get a little information before we off people. It's not a play by ear sort of deal.
quotes.author: Holly Hood

quotes.text: I'd give in to the grief but make sure I wasn't loud enough to draw attention from those who think words will make me feel better.
quotes.author: Adam Silvera

quotes.text: Time has always been the greatest ally to Truth, because Time eventually relieves and reveals all.
quotes.author: Suzy Kassem

quotes.text: Neither the sun nor death can be looked at steadily.
quotes.author: La Rochefoucauld

quotes.text: Alive. Alive in the way that death is alive.
quotes.author: John Fowles

quotes.text: Time doesn't heal all wounds. We both know that's bullshit; it comes from people who have nothing comforting or original to say.
quotes.author: Adam Silvera

quotes.text: I always knew, on some level, that I wouldn't live long. It's simply not written in my stars.
quotes.author: Marie Lu

quotes.text: Where music thundered let the mind be still,Where the will triumphed let there be no will,What light revealed, now let the dark fulfill.
quotes.author: May Sarton

quotes.text: I learned a little of beauty - enough to know that it had nothing to do with truth - and I found, moreover, that there was no great literary tradition; there was only the tradition of the eventful death of every literary tradition.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.text: Don't wake me for the end of the world unless it has very good special effects.
quotes.author: Roger Zelazny

quotes.text: Whilst the wolflets bayed, A grave was made, And then with the strokes of a silver spade, It was filled to make a mound. And for two cold days and three long nights, The father tended that holy plot; And stayed by where his wife was laid, In the grave within the ground.
quotes.author: Roman Payne

quotes.text: Everybody know death is inevitably coming, but it never fails to catch everybody by surprise everytime one is going
quotes.author: Hlovate

quotes.text: Only happy people have nightmares, from overeating. For those who live a nightmare reality, sleep is a black hole, lost in time, like death.
quotes.author: Guy Sajer

quotes.text: Absence is a house so vast that inside you will pass through its walls and hang pictures on the air.
quotes.author: Pablo Neruda

quotes.text: Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.
quotes.author: Kabir

quotes.text: It was an indulgence, learning last words. Other people had chocolate; I had dying declarations.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: We carry the dead with us only until we die too, and then it is we who are borne along for a little while, and then our bearers in their turn drop, and so on into the unimaginable generations.
quotes.author: John Banville

quotes.text: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Criminals do not die by the hands of the law. They die by the hands of other men.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: Well, as to that, all I'll say is, you can't take out a fellow's heart before he's ready to give it up.
quotes.author: Louis Bayard

quotes.text: As for Gussie Finknottle, many an experienced undertaker would have been deceived by his appearance and started embalming on sight.
quotes.author: Wodehouse

quotes.text: All primitive people are frightened of owls,' said Harley. 'The villagers here are scared to death of the gufo. Birds of ill omen. If they see one, they think they'll die. But they never do. See one, I mean, of course,' he added with a laugh.
quotes.author: Francis Brett Young

quotes.text: Oh dire, dreadful death, you drag your heels.Why dawdle and draw back? You drown my heart.
quotes.author: Simon Armitage

quotes.text: Just as when we come into the world, when we die we are afraid of the unknown. But the fear is something from within us that has nothing to do with reality. Dying is like being born: just a change.
quotes.author: Isabel Allende

quotes.text: My religious beliefs teach me to feel as safe in battle as in bed. God has fixed the time of my death. I do not concern myself with that, but to be always ready whenever it may overtake me. That is the way all men should live, and all men would be equally brave.
quotes.author: Stonewall Jackson

quotes.text: The bird is gone, and in what meadow does it now sing?
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.text: Death is fugitive; even when you're watching for it, the actual instant somehow slips between your fingers. You don't get that sudden drop of the head you see in movies. Instead you simply sit there, waiting for something to happen, and all at once you realize you've missed it.
quotes.author: Jonathan Stroud

quotes.text: When I die, don't come, I wouldn't want a leafto turn away from the sun -- it loves it there.There's nothing so spiritual about being happybut you can't miss a day of it, because it doesn't last.
quotes.author: Frank O'Hara

quotes.text: I was tired of being me.
quotes.author: Rachel Ward

quotes.text: Men's lives have meaning, not their deaths.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: Was there any meaning to life or to war, that two men should sit together and jump within seconds of each other and yet never meet on the ground below?
quotes.author: David Kenyon Webster

quotes.text: And in such bliss does devastation grow.
quotes.author: Roshani Chokshi

quotes.text: Neighbours complaining about someone's dog making an awful racket. You could hardly blame the poor beast, its owner had died in her bed at least a fortnight before and there hadn't been much left of the old girl worth eating.
quotes.author: James Oswald

quotes.text: Afterwards, when it's all over, you meet God. What do you say to God?
quotes.author: Yann Martel

quotes.text: We love ourselves notwithstanding our faults, and we ought to love our friends in like manner.
quotes.author: Cyrus the Great

quotes.text: Every time I go to sleep, I know I may never wake up. How could anyone expect to? You drop your tiny, helpless mind into a bottomless well, crossing your fingers and hoping when you pull it out on its flimsy fishing wire it hasn't been gnawed to bones by nameless beasts below.
quotes.author: Isaac Marion

quotes.text: Adam is crying and somewhere inside of me I am crying, too, because I'm feeling things at last. I'm feeling not just the physical pain, but all that I have lost, and it is profound and catastrophic and will leave a crater in me that nothing will ever fill.
quotes.author: Gayle Forman

quotes.text: The real hell of this," he told her, "is that you're going to get through it.
quotes.author: Gail Caldwell

quotes.text: There is just as much beauty in birth as there is in death, and it changes our lives just the same. They both add things to us and take things away." Pg. 155 Undone
quotes.author: Brooke Taylor

quotes.text: Only the previous day, Arch had found him in a spirit-dance corral, blistering the creatures to the point of death, such was his need to touch and destroy.
quotes.author: Frank Beddor

quotes.text: I am afraid of death. You are young, so presumably you're more afraid of it than I am. Obviously we shall put if off as long as we can. But it makes very little difference. So long as human beings stay human, death and life are the same thing.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: So long as human beings stay human, death and life are the same thing.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: Places change imperceptibly '“ in detail, at least '“ a good deal,' said the Doctor, making an effort to keep up a conversation that plainly would not go on itself; 'and people too; population shifts '“ there's an old fellow, sir, they call Death.
quotes.author: Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu

quotes.text: My wallpaper and I are fighting a duel to the death. One or the other of us has to go.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I used to love youI still doSo SelfishI love the old youThe you that didnt shoot drugs...The you that didnt get beat on by menYou laugh in my face and call me a foolBut its trueI still love youSometimes,I can see the old youWhen your eyes flashWhen you almost look alive
quotes.author: Henry Rollins

quotes.text: For some death is an art, for others it is merely an inevitability.
quotes.author: Sadie S. Forsythe

quotes.text: But death was her curse and her gift, and death had been her good friend these long, long years.
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.text: La vida es mi tortura y la muerte serÃƒ¡ mi descanso.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Death ends a life, but it does not end a relationship, which struggles on in the survivor's mind toward some final resolution, some clear meaning, which it perhaps never finds.
quotes.author: Robert Woodruff Anderson

quotes.text: What is this slow blue dream of living, and this fevered death by dreaming?
quotes.author: Aberjhani

quotes.text: I have nothing now but praise for my life. I'm not unhappy. I cry a lot because I miss people. They die and I can't stop them. They leave me and I love them more...
quotes.author: Maurice Sendak

quotes.text: Sprawled out on the front lawn Looking up at an ordinary sky It could fall on me and somehow be The day I didn't die
quotes.author: Nick Burd

quotes.text: You can't argue with the dead, no matter what you say, they always have the last word.
quotes.author: Jennifer Donnelly

quotes.text: Miss Mary Mack, Mack, Mack, all dressed in black, black, black. She has a knife, knife, knife, stuck in her back, back, back. She cannot breathe, breathe, breathe. She cannot cry, cry, cry. Thats why she begs, begs, begs. She begs to die, die ,die..
quotes.author: Laurie Faria Stolarz

quotes.text: I truly believe I am not afraid of death. What I shrink from, I believe, is the shame of dying as stupid and befuddled as I am.
quotes.author: J.M. Coetzee

quotes.text: Happiness is the change that comes over mewhen I describe the worldIt comes over the worldHappiness is the change that comes over mewhen I'm afraidIt comes over the worldFor instance I can be afraid of and for the worldafraid because the world consists among other thingsof me so swiftly dying
quotes.author: Inger Christensen

quotes.text: These things are lost to oblivion like so much about so many who are born and die without anyone taking the time to write it all down. That Litvinoff had a wife who was so devoted is, to be frank, the only reason anyone knows anything about him at all.
quotes.author: Nicole Krauss

quotes.text: I think people believe in heaven because they don't like the idea of dying, because they want to carry on living and they don't like the idea that other people will move into their house and put their things into the rubbish.
quotes.author: Mark Haddon

quotes.text: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
quotes.author: Lord George Gordon Byron

quotes.text: And this evening when I close my eyes against the darkness and think about her, I'll imagine iridescent wings fluttering, if only for a moment, against cloudless blue skies.
quotes.author: Nancy Stephan

quotes.text: And they had folded his brother's hands across his suited chest, as if he would be preserved in this sanguine pose forever, but only the heavy callouses visible at the sides of his hands seemed real. It was only the callouses that appeared to be familiar and believable.
quotes.author: Kent Haruf

quotes.text: Death was for-the other people.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.text: I know, too, that death is the only god who comes when you call.
quotes.author: Roger Zelazny

quotes.text: Desire is half of life; indifference is half of death.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: Not that there's anything wrong with just lying around on your back. In it's way, rotting is interesting too, as we will see. It's just that there are other ways to spend your time as a cadaver.
quotes.author: Mary Roach

quotes.text: If you can overcome love, you can overcome fear. If you can overcome fear, you can overcome death.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.text: You'll stay with me?'Until the very end,' said James.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling

quotes.text: As I accepted my death and dissolution into God's love, the insectoids began feeding on my heart, devouring the feelings of love and surrender. They were interested in emotion. As I was holding on to my last thought - that God is love - they asked, "Even here? Even here?
quotes.author: Rick Strassman

quotes.text: There was a lot they didn't tell you about death, she had discovered, and one of the biggies was how long it took the ones you loved most to die in your heart.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: And in this moment, I realize one reason it's so great to have a best friend is sometimes, like right now, Cal and I are thinking the very same thing.
quotes.author: Kimberly Willis Holt

quotes.text: Wenn jemand starb, dem du dein Herz geschenkt hattest, nahm er es dann mit?
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: One of the grubby truths about a loss is that you don't just mourn the dead person, you mourn the person you got to be when the lost one was alive. This loss might even be what affects you most.
quotes.author: Meghan O'Rourke

quotes.text: Never send to know for whom the bells tolls; it tolls for thee.
quotes.author: John Donne

quotes.text: Dying's a fearful popular activity these days so we often double 'em up.
quotes.author: John Marsden

quotes.text: You and I have a connection that nothing, not on heaven or earth, or even hell, could ever break. If you want to talk to me, talk to me. I'll hear you'¦
quotes.author: Cynthia Hand

quotes.text: who wants flowers when youre dead? nobody.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.text: Only those few who are able to surpass their fear of death completely can fully experience the highest forms of life; not the mundane life of the mortal, but the godly life of the resurrected.
quotes.author: Zeena Schreck

quotes.text: She had thought he was dead, or at least not totally alive, and you could not still be dating someone you believe had an autopsy, so it was not really cheating.
quotes.author: Thomm Quackenbush

quotes.text: Your mother died to save you. If there is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. Love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves it's own mark. To have been loved so deeply, even though the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: Kill me, or you are a murderer.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: You that in far-off countries of the sky can dwell secure, look back upon me here; for I am weary of this frail world's decay.
quotes.author: Murasaki Shikibu

quotes.text: He would find his Susie,inside his young son. Give that love to the living.
quotes.author: Alice Sebold

quotes.text: His name was Theo.
quotes.author: Cinda Williams Chima

quotes.text: Music, When Soft Voices DieMusic, when soft voices die, Vibrates in the memory; Odours, when sweet violets sicken, Live within the sense they quicken. Rose leaves, when the rose is dead, Are heap'd for the belovÃƒ¨d's bed; And so thy thoughts, when thou art gone, Love itself shall slumber on.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: Excuse me," she said politely. "But you can't have him. Not yet. He's going to come back with me.
quotes.author: Tamora Pierce

quotes.text: ... just because [butterflies'] lives were short didn't mean they were tragic... See, they have a beautiful life.
quotes.author: Lisa Genova

quotes.text: She surveyed the carnage behind him. "Did you have fun?"He showed her his teeth. "Yes.
quotes.author: Ilona Andrews

quotes.text: Here is a list of terrible things,The jaws of sharks, a vultures wingsThe rabid bite of the dogs of war,The voice of one who went before,But most of all the mirror's gaze,Which counts us out our numbered days.
quotes.author: Clive Barker

quotes.text: The foolish rush to end their lives.Only the steadfast soul survives.
quotes.author: Christine de Pizan

quotes.text: Reality means you live until you die...the real truth is nobody wants reality.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: The thing about dead people... The thing is you sound like a bastard if you don't romanticize them, but the truth is... complicated, I guess.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: All through life there were distinctions - toilets for men, toilets for women; clothes for men, clothes for women - then, at the end, the graves are identical.
quotes.author: Leila Aboulela

quotes.text: Mostly I couldn't bear... the paltry notion that memory was all that eternal life really meant, and I spent too much time wondering where people got the fortitude or delusion to keep on moving past the static dead.
quotes.author: Gail Caldwell

quotes.text: And you know, there's less charm in life when you think about death--but it's more peaceful.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: Nothing is ever truly gone... Not for me, nor for any human being. We can only go forward, unless we are guests in some enchantment that is not is ours. We are condemned to an endless present, and we can never go back-the source of all our joy, and all our sorrow." -Hem at Zelika's grave
quotes.author: Alison Croggon

quotes.text: We each owe a death, there are no exceptions, I know that, but sometimes, oh God, the Green Mile is so long.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: So it is said, for him who understands Heavenly joy, life is the working of Heaven; death is the transformation of things. In stillness, he and the yin share a single Virtue; in motion, he and the yang share a single flow.
quotes.author: Zhuangzi

quotes.text: My sister, Judy, has always said that she would like to lie in state, propped up in her coffin with her eyes blared wide open, face fixed in a big grin, and have a taped greeting for all her mourners. Something real upbeat and, well, live-sounding, like: 'He-e-e-ey!Cuteshoestellyomamahi!
quotes.author: Jill Conner Browne

quotes.text: And having once chosen, never to seek to return to the crossroads of that decision-for even if one chooses wrongly, the choice cannot be unmade.
quotes.author: Jacqueline Carey

quotes.text: Depression isn't a war you win. It's a battle you fight every day. You never stop, never get to rest. It's one bloody fray after another.
quotes.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

quotes.text: What is life? It departs covertly. Like a thief Death took him.
quotes.author: John Gunther

quotes.text: They say the sky is the same everywhere. Travellers, the shipwrecked, exiles, and the dying draw comfort from the thought[.]
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: One day u will be the message...a message for those who still alive...
quotes.author: Fayrouz Yasser

quotes.text: They go on to this better place, you know, which is what they wanted all along. But you and me, we're still left behind with all the questions they couldn't answer.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: Do you want to know something about tyrants? When faced with death, they weep and they beg just like the rest of us.
quotes.author: Melina Marchetta

quotes.text: The beauty of the sea is that it never shows any weakness and never tires of the countless souls that unleash their broken voices into its secret depths.
quotes.author: Zeina Kassem

quotes.text: He loved me and I loved him, but the number in my head was telling me that he was going to die today. And the numbers had never been wrong.
quotes.author: Rachel Ward

quotes.text: In time, in time they tell me, I'll not feel so bad. I don't want time to heal me. There's a reason I'm like this.I want time to set me ugly and knotted with loss of you, marking me. I won't smooth you away.I can't say goodbye.
quotes.author: China MiÃƒÂ©ville

quotes.text: Here lies a gentleman boldWho was so very braveHe went to lengths untold,And on the brink of the graveDeath had on him no hold.By the world he set small store--He frightened it to the core--Yet somehow, by Fate's plan,Though he'd lived a crazy man,When he died he was sane once more.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quotes.text: I must confess, I have always wondered what lay beyond life, my dear.Yeah, everybody wonders. And sooner or later everybody gets to find out.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: One of the inescapable encumbrances of leading an interesting life is that there have to be moments when you almost lose it.
quotes.author: Jimmy Buffett

quotes.text: He could not stand. It was notThat he could not thrive, he was bornWith everything but the will '“That can be deformed, just like a limb.Death was more interesting to him.Life could not get his attention.
quotes.author: Ted Hughes

quotes.text: ***HERE IS A SMALL FACT*** You are going to die.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: And will 'a not come again? And will 'a not come again? No, no, he is dead, Go to thy death bed: He will never come again.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: To pursue wisdom is to live in such a way that one is prepared to face death when it comes. (247)
quotes.author: Gregory Bassham

quotes.text: Knackered inmates are easier to control than pumped-up ones. And dead inmates are even easier to control, if you follow me.
quotes.author: Alexander Gordon Smith

quotes.text: One of my biggest fears is that I'm going to die alone in my home, and my cats will eat me because I am too dead to open their food cans.
quotes.author: Kelli Jae Baeli

quotes.text: I find myself thinking about my ongoing existence as a human being and the path that lies ahead of me. Though of course these thoughts lead to but one place - death.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: Death doesn't exist. It never did, it never will. But we've drawn so many pictures of it, so many years, trying to pin it down, comprehend it, we've got to thinking of it as an entity, strangely alive and greedy. All it is, however, is a stopped watch, a loss, an end, a darkness. Nothing.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: Life isn't fair. A fair's a place where you eat corn dogs and ride the ferris wheel.
quotes.author: Jennifer Brown

quotes.text: See, as much as you want to hold on to the bitter sore memory that someone has left this world, you are still in it. And the very act of living is a tide: at first it seems to make no difference at all, and then one day you look down and see how much pain has eroded.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: Remember me, even if it's only in a corner and secretly. Don't let me go.
quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz ZafÃƒÂ³n

quotes.text: La tristesse durera toujours.[The sadness will last forever.]
quotes.author: Vincent van Gogh

quotes.text: One of the gravestones in the cemetery near the earliest church has an anchor on it and an hourglass, and the words In Hope.In Hope. Why did they put that above a dead person? Was it the corpse hoping, or those still alive?
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

quotes.text: Whatever distinguishes one lump of flesh from another when we're alive, we're all the same once we're dead. Just used-up shells.
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quotes.text: I've never once thought about how I was going to die,' she said. 'œI can't think about it. I don't even know how I'm going to live.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: Yer a good lad, Atticus, mowin' me lawn and killin' what Brits come around.
quotes.author: Kevin Hearne

quotes.text: The kiss. Oh, the kiss. What a perfect, unnerving, luscious kiss. He made me feel unhinged . . . like he could take me apart and put me back together again and again.
quotes.author: Chelsie Shakespeare

quotes.text: Can I just say that dying sucks? All that bullshit about seeing the light and having this inner peace, blah, blah, blah. It's crap.
quotes.author: Julie Kenner

quotes.text: Death is part of who we are. It guidesus. It shapes us. It drives us to madness. Can you still be human if you have no mortal end
quotes.author: Christopher Paolini

quotes.text: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: When darkness falls and eyes stay shutA chain of voices opens up.Let wax not wane give breath to death.p.s. Shhh" -Yvonne Woon(Dead Beautiful)
quotes.author: yvonne woon

quotes.text: Maybe you should say goodbye, Cal.''No.''It might be important.''It might make her die.
quotes.author: Jenny Downham

quotes.text: Finally there is nothing here for death to take away.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: She was made mostly of coffee and empty spaces.
quotes.author: Adelise M. Cullens

quotes.text: The dead look so terribly dead when they're dead.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.text: In a world where the dead have returned to life, the word" trouble' loses much of its meaning.
quotes.author: Dennis Hopper

quotes.text: Then Thalia Grace became their leader and started recruiting even more young women to their cause, which grated on Nico '“ as if Bianca's death could be forgotten. As if she could be replaced.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.text: I could write my name across the sky, and it would be in invisible ink.
quotes.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

quotes.text: I was not, I was, I am not, I care not. (Non fui, fui, non sum, non curo)
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.text: If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: About here, she thought, dabbling her fingers in the water, a ship had sunk, and she muttered, dreamily half asleep, how we perished, each alone.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: Harry, you wonderful boy, you brave, brave man.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: You Hang on to your pain like it means something; like it's worth something. Well, let me tell you, it's not worth shit, so let it go. Infinite Possibilities and all you can do is whine.""Well, what am I supposed to do?""What do you think? You can do anything, you lucky bastard; You're alive!
quotes.author: Nancy Oliver

quotes.text: It's better to burn out than to fade away.
quotes.author: Kurt Cobain

quotes.text: To you, death does not simply end life. It steals away the sunsets you'll never see, the children you'll never hold, the wife you'll never love. It's frightening to almost lose your future, and it's heartbreaking to witness death snuff out other people's tomorrows.
quotes.author: Robert Liparulo

quotes.text: God waits only the separation of spirit from flesh to crown us with a full reward. Why, then, should we ever sink overwhelmed with distress, when life is so soon over, and death is so certain an entrance to happiness -- to glory?
quotes.author: Charlotte BrontÃƒÂ«

quotes.text: I can't do anything to death, doctor's orders.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: A halo surrounded the grim reaper nun, Sister Maria. (By the way-I like this human idea of the grim reaper. I like the scythe. It amuses me.)
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Things die. But they don't always stay dead. Believe me, I know.
quotes.author: Richelle Mead

quotes.text: She died in my arms, saying, "I don't want to die." That is what death is like. It doesn't matter what uniforms the soldiers are wearing. It doesn't matter how good the weapons are. I thought if everyone could see what I saw, we would never have war anymore.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.text: She had lost all our memories for ever, and it was as though by dying she had robbed me of part of myself. I was losing my individuality. It was the first stage of my own death, the memories dropping off like gangrened limbs.
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.text: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Madness doesn't get off wearing gloves. It needs to feel skin on skin, smell the blood and shit as it brings itself off.
quotes.author: Benjamin R. Smith

quotes.text: The evil that men do lives after them;The good is oft interred with their bones.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: I look back to where my life had been. It's always risky to think of letting go. That's why this is the perfect ending. Nothing left to reconcile.
quotes.author: Loretta Ellsworth

quotes.text: The dead could only speak through the mouths of those left behind, and through the signs they left scattered behind them.
quotes.author: Robert Galbraith

quotes.text: The crickets still sing in October. And lilly, she's trying to bloom. Tho she's resting her head on the shoulder of death, she still shines by the light of the moon.
quotes.author: Kevin Dalton  Faubush Hill

quotes.text: The heaviness of loss in her heart hadn't eased, but there was room there for humour, too.
quotes.author: Nalo Hopkinson

quotes.text: Does anybody know which are the thoughts of God, even if they are plants, mountains, sky, stars or whatever else?
quotes.author: Sorin Cerin

quotes.text: There was no safety. There was no pride. All there was, was money. Everything became money, and money became everything. Money treated us as if we were things, and we died.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: I am dying now, but I still have many things to say.
quotes.author: Roberto BolaÃƒÂ±o

quotes.text: We think of mortality so little these days...I thought of the stern Victorian determination to keep death in mind, the uncompromising tombstones.Remember, pilgrim, as you pass by,As you are now so once was I:As I am so will you be...
quotes.author: Tana French

quotes.text: Together, they would watch everything that was so carefully planned collapse, and they would smile at the beauty of destruction.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: I am alone on this road strewn with bones and bordered by ruins! Angels have their brothers, and demons have their infernal companions. Yet I have but the sound of my scythe when it harvests, my whistling arrows, my galloping horse. Always the sound of the same wave eating away at the world
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.text: a penny for my thoughts oh no i'll sell em for a dollar their worth so much more after im a goner and then maybe you'll hear the words ive been singing funny when your dead how people start listening
quotes.author: The Band Perry

quotes.text: I never understood why when you died, you didn't just vanish, everything should just keep going on the way it was only you just wouldn't be there. I always thought I'd like my own tombstone to be blank. No epitaph, and no name. Well, actually, I'd like it to say 'figment'.
quotes.author: Andy Warhol

quotes.text: Think about that for a moment. They died for you. Now take a good look at the life you're living and tell me: Did they do the right thing?
quotes.author: Mira Grant

quotes.text: '¦Not that it was unjust; not that the scales were forced out of balance. Where there had been good, it showed as clearly. Kindnesses, accomplishments, all those were present, too.
quotes.author: Richard Matheson

quotes.text: In the time that we're here today, more women and children will die violently in the Darfur region than in Iraq, Afghanistan, Palestine, Israel or Lebanon. So, after September 30, you won't need the UN - you will simply need men with shovels and bleached white linen and headstones.
quotes.author: George Clooney

quotes.text: The awful thing is that if i can forget they're people, it will be no different at all
quotes.author: suzanne collins

quotes.text: Can't clean up after you anymore, baby brother, so don't punk out. Make it count.
quotes.author: Rachel Vincent

quotes.text: Not only had my brother disappeared, but--and bear with me here--a part of my very being had gone with him. Stories about us could, from them on, be told from only one perspective. Memories could be told but not shared.
quotes.author: John Corey Whaley

quotes.text: There is love in holding and there is love in letting go.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Berg

quotes.text: I am forever walking upon these shores,Betwixt the sand and the foam,The high tide will erase my foot prints,And the wind will blow away the foam,But the sea and the shore will remain forever.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: If I convert it's because it's better that a believer dies than that an atheist does.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: When we're all gone at last then there'll be nobody here but death and his days will be numbered too. He'll be out in the road there with nothing to do and nobody to do it to. He'll say: where did everybody go? And that's how it will be. What's wrong with that?
quotes.author: Cormac McCarthy

quotes.text: I'm going to die. And as if that weren't bad enough, I'm going to die inside a cake.
quotes.author: Peter H. Fogtdal

quotes.text: You try spending six months sitting at somebody's bedside, waiting for them to die and then tell me that the happy-ending love story isn't one of God's good gifts.
quotes.author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

quotes.text: How wicked it would be, if we could, to call the dead back! She said not to me but to the chaplain, 'I am at peace with God.' She smiled, but not at me. Poi si torno all' eterna fontana.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: I know that it's easier to look at death than it is to look at pain, because while death is irrevocable, and the grief will lessen in time, pain is too often merely relentless and irreversible.
quotes.author: Robert Goolrick

quotes.text: Love is how you stay alive, even after you are gone.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom

quotes.text: For some folks death is release, and for others death is an abomination, a terrible thing. But in the end, I'm there for all of them.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: Surplus meant unnecessary. Not required.You couldn't be a Surplus if you were needed by someone else. You couldn't be a Surplus if you were loved.
quotes.author: Gemma Malley

quotes.text: Dr. Beall gave him the first shot, followed closely by the second.He said, "I'll check for a heartbeat."I said, "You don't need to. I can see it in his eyes."Dewey was gone.
quotes.author: Vicki Myron

quotes.text: Death is impatient and thoughtless. It barges into your room when you are right in the middle of something, and it doesn't bother to wipe its boots.
quotes.author: Tom Robbins

quotes.text: die daily.hourly, if you'vegot the energy.
quotes.author: Sherwin Tjia

quotes.text: She made the decision that her existence had lost its meaning. And you cannot judge that.
quotes.author: Jack Kevorkian

quotes.text: What can I say? I prefer to die well informed.
quotes.author: Nalini Singh

quotes.text: In a world where everyone struggles to survive whatever the cost, how could one judge those who decide to die?
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: I was born when you kissed me. I died when you left me. I lived a few weeks while you loved me.
quotes.author: Dorothy B. Hughes

quotes.text: But before you start pointing fingers, let me ask you: is what I did really so bad? So bad I deserved to die? So bad I deserved to die like that?Is what I did really so much worse than what anybody else does? Is it really so much worse than what you do?Think about it.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver

quotes.text: waitingin a life full of little storiesfor a death to come
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: I grew up in a hospital and as a child I played in the dissecting room
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.text: Life is a bitter sweet journey my friend, a bitter sweet journey.
quotes.author: Luellen Hoffman

quotes.text: Every blade in the field - Every leaf in the forest - lays down its life in its season as beautifully as it was taken up.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: ... we die, just as we were born, at the edge of a road not of our choosing.
quotes.author: Amin Maalouf

quotes.text: Just know I amNot there to catch youBut I am there for you
quotes.author: Caleb Warta/Ritter

quotes.text: And in what fairy tale would John ever be any sane person's idea of Prince Charming anyway? He was the opposite of charming. More like Prince Terrifying.
quotes.author: Meg Cabot

quotes.text: When he shall die,Take him and cut him out in little stars,And he will make the face of heaven so fineThat all the world will be in love with nightAnd pay no worship to the garish sun.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: When people get a chance to come close to death without having it touch them personally, they never miss the opportunity.
quotes.author: Herman Koch

quotes.text: Do people look the same when they go to heaven, mommy?""I don't know. I don't think so.""Then how do people recognize each other?""I don't know, sweetie. They just feel it. You don't need your eyes to love, right?
quotes.author: R.J. Palacio

quotes.text: Death twitches my ear;'Live,' he says... 'I'm coming.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.text: My flesh winced, in cowardice, from such a death.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: The day after Paul Newman was dead, he was twice as dead.
quotes.author: Maurice Sendak

quotes.text: No sense of the irony of human experience, that we are the highest form of life on earth, and yet ineffably sad because we know what no other animal knows, that we must die.
quotes.author: Don DeLillo

quotes.text: It wasn't his, it wasn't my fault,we both had nothing except patience,but Death has none. I saw him come (how meanly!)and I watched him as he took and took:none of it I could claim as mine.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quotes.text: And when life's sweet fable ends,Soul and body part like friends;No quarrels, murmurs, no delay;A kiss, a sigh, and so away.
quotes.author: Richard Crashaw

quotes.text: Perhaps a man really dies when his brain stops, when he loses the power to take in a new idea.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: If you are distant and misanthropic, selfish or cruel, you will find yourself alone in life and death.
quotes.author: Ann Brashares

quotes.text: Grimly, she realized that clocks don't make a sound that even remotely resembles ticking, tocking. It was more the sound of a hammer, upside down, hacking methodically at the earth. It was the sound of a grave.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Forget it. Never explain; never apologize. You can either write posthumously or you can't.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: I would rather live than die. I would rather die than survive as a monster.
quotes.author: Robert Fanney

quotes.text: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
quotes.author: Yoko Ono

quotes.text: Where they burn books, at the end they also burn people
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.text: I feel the terror of idleness,like a red thirst.Death isn't just an idea.
quotes.author: Mary Oliver

quotes.text: Pray for the dead and fight like hell for the living.
quotes.author: Mother Jones

quotes.text: Poets are interested primarily in death and commas.
quotes.author: Carolyn Kizer

quotes.text: Be sure that head and heart were laidIn wisdom down, content to die.Be sure he faced the Starless SkyUnduped, unmurmuring, unafraid.('œThe Passing of Bierce')
quotes.author: George Sterling

quotes.text: It doesn't matter how much his mother loves him; love is not enough to keep any of us alive.
quotes.author: Lauren DeStefanos

quotes.text: the first quality of an honest man is contempt for religion, which would have us afraid of the most natural thing in the world, which is death; and would have us hate the one beautiful thing destiny has given us, which is life.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: It kills me sometimes, how people die.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Cover her face; mine eyes dazzle. She died young.
quotes.author: John Webster

quotes.text: Nothing shall part us in our love till Thanatos (Death) at his appointed hour removed us from the light of day.
quotes.author: Apollonius Rhodius

quotes.text: I shall soon be quite dead at last in spite of all.
quotes.author: Samuel Beckett

quotes.text: I see no end to my misery but the grave.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: Grief is like the ocean; it comes on waves ebbing and flowing. Sometimes the water is calm, and sometimes it is overwhelming. All we can do is learn to swim.
quotes.author: Vicki Harrison

quotes.text: for some reason, dying men always ask the question they know the answer to. perhaps it's so they can die being right.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Because no one needs to live for ever. I think that sometimes you can outstay your welcome.
quotes.author: Gemma Malley

quotes.text: The cries of the dead are terrible indeed; you should try not to hear them.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.text: Having made the decision to love, had I chosen life instead of death?
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: Now every mortal has painand sweat is constant,but if there is anything dearer than being alive,it's dark to me.We humans seem disastrously in love with this thing(whatever it is) that glitters on the earth--we call it life. We know no other.The underworld's a blankand all the rest just fantasy.
quotes.author: Anne Carson

quotes.text: If you really want to stay the same age you are now forever and ever, she'd be thinking, try jumping off the roof: death's a sure-fire method for stopping time.
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

quotes.text: We're all dead the moment we're born. Just, some of us get there faster than others.
quotes.author: Alex Scarrow

quotes.text: The day you lose someone isn't the worst -at least you've got something to do- it's all the days they stay dead.
quotes.author: Steven Moffat

quotes.text: ROSENCRANTZ My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go with us to the king.HAMLET The body is with the king, but the king is not with the body. The king is a thing -GUILDENSTERN A thing my lord?HAMLET Of nothing. Bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Only in death will we have our own names since only in death are we no longer part of the effort. In death we become heroes.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: There I lay, wearing dead people as armor against death.
quotes.author: Andrew Davidson

quotes.text: Man. Being mostly dead is hard on a guy.
quotes.author: Jim Butcher

quotes.text: One hand was behind his back, and he held it out, presenting a bouquet of white and smoky purple lilies. 'œThey're straight from the underworld, by the way. They are everlasting. They won't die.
quotes.author: Jess C Scott

quotes.text: What happens if a car comes? We die.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.text: It's not what I'd want for at my funeral. When I die, I just want them to plant me somewhere warm. And then when the pretty women walk over my grave I would grab their ankles, like in that movie.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: Dance, my darling dance! If you dance then death can't catch you! Nothing bad can touch you! Dance!
quotes.author: Jackie French

quotes.text: Makhluk kecil kembalilah. Dari tiada ke tiada. Berbahagialah dalam ketiadaanmu.
quotes.author: Soe Hok Gie

quotes.text: Still, they have one thing I envy. Humans, if nothing else, have the good sense to die.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Every story is a story about death. But perhaps, if we are lucky, our story about death is also a story about love.
quotes.author: Helen Humphreys

quotes.text: He wasn't supposed to die,' he cried out, somewhat desperately, petulantly, like a spoiled child. But I could hear other thoughts racing between us.Neither are you.Neither am I.
quotes.author: Patti Smith

quotes.text: Now, I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.
quotes.author: Robert Oppenheimer

quotes.text: When the body escaped mutilation, seldom did the heart go to the grave unscarred.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: Popularity is teenage heroin.
quotes.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

quotes.text: I never saw Death before, and now I seeThat it is warring eyes in a woman's form.
quotes.author: Tiruvalluvar

quotes.text: I dedicate this to all those who did not live to tell it. And may they please forgive me for not having seen it all nor remembered it all, for not having divined all of it - from The Gulag Archipelago
quotes.author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

quotes.text: No death, no doom, no anguish can arouse the surpassing despair which flows from a loss of identity.- Through the Gates of the Silver Key
quotes.author: H.P. Lovecraft

quotes.text: This showed once again that everyone had something different to lose in this battle. Some were concerned for their lives, and some for those they cared most about: rays, sea horses, even the chickens that ran free in the streets of the city because they couldn't all be caught in time.
quotes.author: Kai Meyer

quotes.text: For death is life. It is only living that is lifeless.
quotes.author: Mervyn Peake

quotes.text: Every thought about death takes a moment of life away.
quotes.author: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.text: Then there's the kind of zombie I've become now: the one who has lost everything'”his brain, his heart, his light, his direction. He wanders the world, bumping into this, tripping over that, but keeps going and going. That is life after death.
quotes.author: Adam Silvera

quotes.text: Death, a necessary end, will come when it will come
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Death is unstoppable. One must face it as a fact of life
quotes.author: D. Aswini

quotes.text: That's how I want to go. Taking my own way out and totally pissing everybody off at the end.
quotes.author: L.J. Smith

quotes.text: But you're dead,' said Harry.'Oh, yes,' said Dumbledore matter-of-factly.'Then... am I dead too?''Ah,' said Dumbledore, smiling still more broadly. 'That is the question, isn't it? On the whole, dear boy, I think not.
quotes.author: J. K. Rowling (Author)

quotes.text: Warmblood now a bloodborne death,Will rob your body of it's breathMark your skin and seal your fate The Underland becomes a plate
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins

quotes.text: If I Must GoIf I must go to heaven's endClimbing the ages like a stair,Be near me and forever bendWith the same eyes above me there;Time will fly past us like leaves flying,We shall not heed, for we shall beBeyond living, beyond dying,Knowing and known unchangeably.
quotes.author: Sara Teasdale

quotes.text: What is life to Spirit, is death to the ego.
quotes.author: Vivian Amis

quotes.text: Carmen will always be free.
quotes.author: Prosper MÃƒÂ©rimÃƒÂ©e

quotes.text: Every time you take a step, even when you don't want to. . . . When it hurts, when it means you rub chins with death, or even if it means dying, that's good. Anything that moves ahead, wins. No chess game was ever won by the player who sat for a lifetime thinking over his next move.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: I always say, if you must mount the gallows, give a jest to the crowd, a coin to the hangman, and make the drop with a smile on your lips.

quotes.text: Healthy children will not fear life if their elders have integrity enough not to fear death.
