quotes.text: Gloria laughed at them and said that she'd overtaken grief a long time ago, that she was tired of everyone wanting to go to heaven, nobody wanting to die. The only thing worth grieving over, she said, was that sometimes there was more beauty in this life than the world could bear.
quotes.author: Colum McCann

quotes.text: Only one thing mattered: this was not a Horcrux. Dumbledore had weakened himself by drinking that horrible potion for nothing. Harry crumpled the parchment in his hand and his eyes burned with tears as behind him Fang began to howl.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: Thinking of death--strange, beautiful, terrible and a long way off--made me feel happier than ever.
quotes.author: Dodie Smith

quotes.text: Everyone feels guilty before a mother who has lost her son in a war; throughout human history men have tried in vain to justify themselves.
quotes.author: Vasily Grossman

quotes.text: It was a year ago today your daughter went missing.' Bagg had closed his eyes, feeling the death going on inside.
quotes.author: Cole Alpaugh

quotes.text: He was Death, and he'd ridden in on a pale horse...
quotes.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

quotes.text: La mayorÃƒ­a de la muerte de la gente es una farsa, no queda en ellos nada que pueda morir
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: We're organisms; we're conceived, we're born, we live, we die, and we decay. But as we decay we feed the world of the living: plants and bugs and bacteria.
quotes.author: Bill Bass

quotes.text: Unless their use by readers bring them to life, books are indeed dead things.
quotes.author: Lawrence Clark Powell

quotes.text: It was said that life was cheap in Ankh-Morpork. This was of course, completely wrong. Life was often very expensive; you could get death for free.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: If one thousand of you participate in the murder of one child, then one thousand of you are a thousand times guilty.
quotes.author: Compton Gage

quotes.text: It came to Mary now that her mother had been right, after all; Mary had been born for this. In sixteen years she'd shot along the shortest route she could find between life and death, as the crow flew.
quotes.author: Emma Donoghue

quotes.text: Suicide sometimes proceeds from cowardice, but not always; for cowardice sometimes prevents it; since as many live because they are afraid to die, as die because they are afraid to live
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.text: If you cannot love me, I will die. Before you came I wanted to die, I have told you many times. It is cruel to have made me want to live only to make my death more bloody.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.text: People die all the time. Life is a lot more fragile than we think. So you should treat others in a way that leaves no regrets. Fairly, and if possible, sincerely. It's too easy not to make the effort, then weep and wring your hands after the person dies.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: Zalos: 'The world is full of massive things in motion. Little creatures get hurt.
quotes.author: Robert Fanney

quotes.text: Prate not to me of suicide, Faint heart in battle, not for pride I say Endure, but that such end denied Makes welcomer yet the death that's to be died.
quotes.author: Stevie Smith

quotes.text: However cozy things seemed, the facts of life were the same. You couldn't escape death: It would get us all in the end.
quotes.author: Rachel Ward

quotes.text: You are afraid to die, and you're afraid to live. What a way to exist.
quotes.author: Neale Donald Walsch

quotes.text: No more let life divide what death can join together.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: A girl always remembers the first corpse she shaves.
quotes.author: Caitlin Doughty

quotes.text: Open questions like love, life, death, struggle and sex are our experiences, our opinions are not answers but they still remain mysterious unanswered questions. Let it be Open.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.text: Glenn used to say the reason you can't really imagine yourself being dead was that as soon as you say, 'I'll be dead,' you've said the word I, and so you're still alive inside the sentence. And that's how people got the idea of the immortality of the soul - it was a consequence of grammar.
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

quotes.text: And what would humans be without love?"RARE, said Death.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: I think it's cool to wear roadkill. If I died and somebody wanted to wear my teeth around their neck to VMAs, I'd feel honored.
quotes.author: Ke$ha

quotes.text: I have noticed that even those who assert that everything is predestined and that we can change nothing about it still look both ways before they cross the street
quotes.author: Stephen W. Hawking

quotes.text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: There are two kinds of people in this world, son. Those who save lives, and those who take lives.""And what of those who protect and defend? Those who save lives by taking lives?""That's like trying to stop a storm by blowing harder. Ridiculous. You can't protect by killing.
quotes.author: Brandon Sanderson

quotes.text: You people have a religion of death that fills you with the joy and courage to confront it...I do not. I believe the only essential thing is to be alive.- Abrenucio
quotes.author: Gabriel GarcÃƒÂ­Ã‚Â­a MÃƒÂ¡rquez

quotes.text: Stop sleeping, Get to work! You will have much time to sleep when you die.
quotes.author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quotes.text: How do you get all those coins?" asked Mort.IN PAIRS.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: Everything ends in death, everything. Death is terrible.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: The hour of departure has arrived, and we go our separate ways, I to die, and you to live. Which of these two is better only God knows.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: To whom could I put this question (with any hope of an answer)? Does being able to live without someone you loved mean you loved her less than you thought...?
quotes.author: Roland Barthes

quotes.text: Death and destruction are necessary to the health of the world, and therefore as natural, and lovable, as birth and life. Only priests and born cowards moan and weep over dying. Brave men face it with approving nonchalance.
quotes.author: Ragnar Redbeard

quotes.text: Civilized society is perpetually menaced with disintegration through this primary hostility of men towards one another.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.text: My idea of God is not a divine idea. It has to be shattered time after time. He shatters it Himself.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: WHEN SOMEBODY GOES AWAY THERE'S THINGS YOU WANT TO TELL THEM. WHEN SOMEBODY DIES MAYBE THAT'S THE WORST THING. YOU WANT TO TELL THEM THINGS THAT HAPPEN AFTER.
quotes.author: Louise Fitzhugh

quotes.text: Man cannot possess anything as long as he fears death. But to him who does not fear it, everything belongs. If there was no suffering, man would not know his limits, would not know himself.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: I like to imagine that, on the day after my last, my library and I will crumble together, so that even when I am no more I'll still be with my books.
quotes.author: Alberto Manguel

quotes.text: The painful truth about life is not death but death while you are alive.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.text: And when he died, I suddenly realized I wasn't crying for him at all, but for the things he did. I cried because he would never do them again...
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: And the dreams so rich in color. How else would death call you? Waking in the cold dawn it all turned to ash instantly. Like certain ancient frescoes entombed for centuries suddenly exposed to the day.
quotes.author: Cormac McCarthy

quotes.text: Everything is true,' he said. 'Everything anybody has ever thought.''Will you be all right?''I'll be all right,' he said, and thought, And I'm going to die. Both those are true, too.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.text: No mother should lose her child.
quotes.author: Ann Hood

quotes.text: All death reminds us that nothing is promised, only that life was worth it.
quotes.author: Shannon Alder

quotes.text: How could you go about choosing something that would hold the half of your heart you had to bury?
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: For two days I went about my business. I travelled the globe as always, handing souls to the conveyor belt of eternity.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: We do not need to grieve for the dead. Why should we grieve for them? They are now in a place where there is no more shadow, darkness, loneliness, isolation, or pain. They are home.
quotes.author: John O'Donohue

quotes.text: He made me feel unhinged . . . like he could take me apart and put me back together again and again.
quotes.author: Chelsie Shakespeare

quotes.text: But death was sweet, death was gentle, death was kind; death healed the bruised spirit and the broken heart, and gave them rest and forgetfulness; death was man's best friend; when man could endure life no longer, death came and set him free.
quotes.author: Mark Twain (Letters From the Earth)

quotes.text: I'd heard that if you saw a Reaper, you saw what you expected to see, what you thought the agents of Death would look like. Personally, I wanted to see little, fuzzy pink bunnies, but apparently my subconscious visualized tall, scary, and skeletal. My subconscious and I needed to have a long talk.
quotes.author: Lisa Shearin

quotes.text: Justice will prevail!
quotes.author: Tsugumi Ohba

quotes.text: We never actively remember death,' Odenigbo said. The reason we live as we do is because we do not remember that we will die. We will all die.
quotes.author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quotes.text: Sometimes there's nothing you can do. [...] Sometimes they don't have enough to fight with.
quotes.author: Tamora Pierce

quotes.text: It is not because other people are dead that our affection for them grows faint, it is because we ourselves are dying.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.text: A funeral is no place for secrets.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom

quotes.text: Not every loss was confirmed by an officer at the door. Nor a telegram with the power to sink a fleet. Loss, often the worst kind, also arrived through the deafening quiet of an absence.
quotes.author: Kristina McMorris

quotes.text: Let's go to Valhalla with the sun on our faces.
quotes.author: Mark Lawrence

quotes.text: But in battle you cannot tell another when it is his time to enter the World-to-Come, nor is it possible to keep any man in this world when he wishes to leave it behind.
quotes.author: Alice Hoffman

quotes.text: The first kiss can be as terrifying as the last.
quotes.author: Daina Chaviano

quotes.text: How soon will we accept this opportunity to be fully alive before we die? (88)
quotes.author: Stephen Levine

quotes.text: The one close to me now,even my own body-these toowill soon become clouds,floating in different directions.
quotes.author: Izumi Shikibu

quotes.text: But often life asks much of you, and you either honor life by answering with all your heart, or you cower your way into your grave.
quotes.author: James Clemens

quotes.text: We're all ghosts. We all carry, inside us, people who came before us.
quotes.author: Liam Callanan

quotes.text: The menopause of Sarah became her menostart; this is feminine beauty! The death plot against Mordecai became his life spring; this is masculine beauty! A kind of life lived in God's word is a life of miraculous beauty!
quotes.author: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.text: Of course I want to kill you," said Skulduggery. "I want to kill most people. But then where would I be? In a field of dead people with no one to talk to.
quotes.author: Derek Landy

quotes.text: The only sin is the sin of being born
quotes.author: Samuel Beckett

quotes.text: He knew that his father had finally run hard enough and long enough to wear down the frontiers between the worlds, he had run clear out of his skin and into the arms of his wife, to whom he had proved, once and for all, the superiority of his love. Some migrants are happy to depart.
quotes.author: Salman Rushdie

quotes.text: You can still be cool when you're dead. In fact, it's much easier, because you aren't getting old and fat and losing your hair.
quotes.author: Audrey Niffenegger

quotes.text: A man who takes into consideration the feelings of others even when arranging the manner of his own death shows a nobility of character which compels the admiration of all classes.
quotes.author: Flann O'Brien

quotes.text: Don't say passed away,' I tell him, drawing from my own terrible well of experience. "Say he died. Death is horrible. We shouldn't give it a pretty name.

quotes.text: And then his noise falls completely silent-And he stops struggling-And looking right into my eyes-He dies.My Todd dies.
quotes.author: Patrick Ness

quotes.text: As death, when we come to consider it closely, is the true goal of our existence, I have formed during the last few years such close relationships with this best and truest friend of mankind that death's image is not only no longer terrifying to me, but is indeed very soothing and consoling.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quotes.text: He killed himself for wanting to live.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Of course what I'm about to share isn't true for me but...Friends, somebody said, are "god's apology for relations." (p. 129)
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: We all love conflagrations. When the sky changes color, it is a dead man's passing.
quotes.author: Andre Breton

quotes.text: No one is actually dead until the ripples they cause in the world die away...
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: The best way to be appreciative for your life is to live it; don't die for any other reason but love. Dreams are what guide us, art is what defines us, math is makes it all possible, and love is what lights our way.

quotes.text: Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last, without frenzy, without apathy, without pretence.

quotes.text: The times that were most fun seemed always to be followed by sadness now, because it was when life started to feel like it did when she was with us that we realized how utterly gone she was.

quotes.text: No one can say that death found in me a willing comrade, or that I went easily.

quotes.text: Of all the wonders that I have heard,It seems to me most strange that men should fear;Seeing death, a necessary end,Will come when it will come.(Act II, Scene 2)

quotes.text: Everyone you have ever loved in your life becomes a part of your soul. They never leave. They're always inside you, and you can bring them out whenever you want.
quotes.author: Nate Kenyon

quotes.text: No popularity exists when tragedy strikes. All that's left are human hearts and love and ache. We all love each other, deep down, and when we see another soul in pain we can't help but hurt too.

quotes.text: But what if all the tranquility, all the comfort, all the contentment were now to come to a horrifying end?

quotes.text: Then hope unlooked-for came so suddenly to Eomer's heart, and with it the bite of care and fear renewed, that he said no more, but turned and went swiftly from the hall.

quotes.text: I planned my death carefully, unlike my life, which meandered along from one thing to another, despite my feeble attempts to control it.

quotes.text: Whatever can die is beautiful '” more beautiful than a unicorn, who lives forever, and who is the most beautiful creature in the world. Do you understand me?

quotes.text: The rest, is silence.

quotes.text: Pain was good. If I hurt, it meant I wasn't dead.

quotes.text: I've been asked by lots of people, "What happens if you do kill yourself?" They want to know about what it would be like for other people around you, like the person who would find your body, the other kids at school, whoever would have to clean up the blood, what your family holidays would be like.
quotes.author: Albert Borris

quotes.text: After I am dead I'd rather have people ask why I have no monument than why I have one.
quotes.author: Cato

quotes.text: Selling eternal life is an unbeatable business, with no customers ever asking for their money back after the goods are not delivered.

quotes.text: When a solipsist dies ... everything goes with him.

quotes.text: In the end, we all lose it. Remember that. In the end, we own nothing.

quotes.text: He saw at least a dozen people still in their seats. Their clothes were torn or blown or burned from their bodies, 'œcompletely naked in front, missing limbs, missing faces, some breathing, some moaning, and others just deader than a door nail.

quotes.text: If only certain things had been preventable, his life would have unfurled in front of him as intended, like a lush Oriental carpet. No surprises, no detours. Just a thick tapestry of days and nights that at the end of his time on earth, he could roll up and proudly claim as his own.
quotes.author: Shilpa Agarwal

quotes.text: If you treat every situation as a life and death matter, you'll die a lot of times.
quotes.author: Dean Smith

quotes.text: Everything worthwhile ends. We are in the perpetual process now: creation, maturation, cessation.

quotes.text: So," he asked. "How's death?""Hard," she said. "It just keeps going.

quotes.text: Death walks faster than the wind and never returns what he has taken.
quotes.author: Hans Christian Andersen

quotes.text: I'm not afraid of death. Death's afraid of me.
quotes.author: Lee Child

quotes.text: Whether we like it or not, the one justification for the existence of all religions is death, they need death as much as we need bread to eat.

quotes.text: The absence of the will to live is, alas, not sufficient to make one want to die.
quotes.author: Michel Houellebecq

quotes.text: I am no wise man. Every day shows me how little I know about life, and how wrong I can be. But there are things I know to be true. I know I will die. And I know that the only sane response to such a horror is to love.

quotes.text: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: End? No, the journey doesn't end here. Death is just another path, one that we all must take. The grey rain-curtain of this world rolls back, and all turns to silver glass, and then you see it.

quotes.text: Let's talk of graves, of worms, and epitaphs;Make dust our paper and with rainy eyesWrite sorrow on the bosom of the earth,Let's choose executors and talk of wills
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Dogs do not have many advantages over people, but one of them is extremely important: euthanasia is not forbidden by law in their case; animals have the right to a merciful death.
quotes.author: Milan Kundera

quotes.text: Death leaves cans of shaving cream half-used.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: There are worse ways to die than warm and drunk.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: And the life of the ebony clock went out with that of the last of the gay. And the flames of the tripods expired. And Darkness and Decay and the Red Death held illimitable dominion over all.

quotes.text: Nothing in his life became him like the leaving it.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Hope could not outlast the breather. Love, however . . . Love was something not even death could conquer, because at the end of everything, even life, he was hers.

quotes.text: Nobody wants to believe that existence carries on without at least taking a stumble from their departure of this world.
quotes.author: Nenia Campbell

quotes.text: I will guard you from Death, for I have no fear of him.
quotes.author: Holly Black

quotes.text: Why is edamame always ready to expire? ItÃ‚´s so urgent for a vegetable. Edamame. It sounds like an assisted form of suicide. Is there an advertising concept in this?
quotes.author: Suzanne Finnamore

quotes.text: I love the name of honor more than I fear death.
quotes.author: julius caesar

quotes.text: It bothered me that he was right. Without Sir Stuart's intervention, I'd have been dead again already.That's right--you heard me: dead again already.I mean, come on. How screwed up is your life (after- or otherwise) when you find yourself needing phrases like that?
quotes.author: Jim Butcher

quotes.text: The planet's tyrant, dotard Death, had held his gray mirror before them for a moment and shown them the image of things to come.
quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quotes.text: A statue stands in a shaded placeAn angel girl with an upturned faceA name is written on a polished rockA broken heart that the world forgot
quotes.author: Martina Mcbride

quotes.text: Now when I die, I shall only be dead.
quotes.author: Richard Matheson

quotes.text: In the end, living is defined by dying.
quotes.author: Bernard Beckett

quotes.text: After your death, you will be what you were before your birth.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.text: Jail's are a spooky place," remarked Bill, trying to match the pace of detective Adam."Oh that is nothing in front of the ultimate fear" replied detective Adam."Ultimate fear?""Funny thing that, the ultimate fear is also the ultimate relief.""Which is?""Death
quotes.author: Rao Umar Javed

quotes.text: Look at the stupid, poor people. Look at the stupid, poor, burned-out people. Look at the stupid, poor, burned-out people, look at their dead baby. It's death porn for the masses.
quotes.author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quotes.text: The shortest distance between two points is a time line, a schedule, a map of your time, the itinerary for the rest of your life.Nothing shows you the straight line from here to death like a list.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: Not forever does the bulbul singIn balmy shades of bowers,Not forever lasts the springNor ever blossom the flowers.Not forever reigneth joy,Sets the sun on days of bliss,Friendships not forever last,They know not life, who know not this.
quotes.author: Khushwant Singh

quotes.text: Oh God, Oh God we're all gonna die doesn't really fit the definition of banter, now does it?
quotes.author: Lilith Saintcrow

quotes.text: One wants to live, of course, indeed one only stays alive by virtue of the fear of death, but I think, as I thought then, that it is better to die violently and not too old.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: Yes, Bastille. I keep trying to get killed because it's inconvenient for you.
quotes.author: Brandon Sanderson

quotes.text: You don't have friends in here, you'll soon come to understand that. You get attached to someone, then you'll just lose them. They'll get shanked or they'll jump or they'll be taken one night.
quotes.author: Alexander Gordon Smith

quotes.text: I like Dancing of Indian girls more than my parents' prayers . Because they dance with love and passion . But my parents just say their prayers because they got used to it .
quotes.author: Ali Shariati

quotes.text: Just like freedom, Truth is not cheap. Yet both are worth more than all the gold in the world. But what is freedom, if there is no truth? And what is truth, if there is no freedom? Both are worth fighting for '” because one without the other would be hell.
quotes.author: Suzy Kassem

quotes.text: Et in Arcadia Ego
quotes.author: Numerous Evelyn Waugh

quotes.text: You can't go back, Ever. You can't change the past. It just is. . . . This is our destiny. Not yours.
quotes.author: Alyson Noel

quotes.text: Nico found a sort of freedom in knowing that eventually, no matter what happened, he would end up at the foot of his father's throne.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.text: Would it hurt to die? All those times he had thought it was about to happen and escaped, he had never really thought of the thing itself: his will to live had always been so much stronger than his fear of death.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: Death is only the end if you assume the story is about you.
quotes.author: The Nightvale Podcast

quotes.text: Why is it we have so little choice? We live like the lowliest worms. Always defeated - defeated we make dinner, we eat, we sleep. Everyone we love is dying. Sill, to cease living is unacceptable.
quotes.author: Banana Yoshimoto

quotes.text: The universal pervasion of ugliness, hideous landscapes, vile noises, foul language...everything. Unnatural, broken, blasted; the distortion of the dead, whose unburiable bodies sit outside the dug outs all day, all night, the most execrable sights on earth. In poetry we call them the most glorious.
quotes.author: Wilfred Owen

quotes.text: Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in mankind, and therefore never send to know for whom the bells tolls; it tolls for thee.
quotes.author: John Donne

quotes.text: When I read obituaries I always note the age of the deceased. Automatically I relate this figure to my own age. Four years to go, I think. Nine more years. Two years and I'm dead. The power of numbers is never more evident than when we use them to speculate on the time of our dying.
quotes.author: Don DeLillo

quotes.text: A complete life may be one ending in so full identification with the non-self that there is no self to die.
quotes.author: Bernard Berenson

quotes.text: War is being reminded that you are completely at the mercy of death at every moment, without the illusion that you are not. Without the distractions that make life worth living.
quotes.author: Francesca Lia Block

quotes.text: We all must face death and walk with it. But we also must love and live in it.
quotes.author: Rolando Mithcell

quotes.text: No drowning man can know which dropOf water his last breath did stop
quotes.author: Charles Sedley

quotes.text: And I don't believe you dead. How can you be dead if I still feel you? Maybe, like God, you changed into something different that I'll have to speak to in a different way, but you not dead to me Nettie. And never will you be.
quotes.author: alice walker

quotes.text: The dead man is on the trolley and the woman collapses across his chest. That's what the ghouls want a shufti at, like at that Princess Diana's funeral, they want to scrutinise those who really knew her, to drink the misery out of their faces.
quotes.author: Irvine Welsh

quotes.text: If they killed him tonight, at least he would die alive.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: The only certainty is death.
quotes.author: Guy de Maupassant

quotes.text: I know I should look away, let him grieve in private, but I cannot. The sweet girl that I knew only briefly is the key to this gentle beast who has captured my heart.
quotes.author: Robin LaFevers

quotes.text: The meaning of life is that it stops.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: As if the dead really do persist, even in a bottle of wine.
quotes.author: Thomas Pynchon

quotes.text: If they succeed, it will not matter if Man becomes immortal.He will have nothing to live for.
quotes.author: James Edwin Gunn

quotes.text: Whatever happens to your body, your soul will survive, untouched...
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: Surely it was a good way to die, in the place of someone else, someone I loved.
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer

quotes.text: One day we were born, one day we shall die, the same day, the same second.
quotes.author: Samuel Beckett

quotes.text: Life is about moving, it's about change. And when things stop doing that they're dead.
quotes.author: Twyla Tharp

quotes.text: The spirit who inhabits her animates us all. Destroy the host, you destroy the power. The young die first; the old wither slowly; the eldest perhaps would go last. But she is the Queen of the Damned, and the Damned can't live without her.
quotes.author: Anne Rice

quotes.text: I have always been afraid... Always been pretending to follow you closely, alwyas been pretending to sharpen my teeth, when the truth is, I am ... scared to death just treading on your shadow.
quotes.author: Tite Kubo

quotes.text: Fear of death is form of stasis horrors. The dead weight of time.
quotes.author: William S. Burroughs

quotes.text: The thing about butterflies, Mr. Crow, is that they need to be admired from afar.

quotes.text: What is called a reason for living is also an excellent reason for dying.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: I came in haste with cursing breath,And heart of hardest steel;But when I saw thee cold in death,I felt as man should feel.For when I look upon that face,That cold, unheeding, frigid brown,Where neither rage nor fear has place,By Heaven! I cannot hate thee now!
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.text: Everything but a life can be replaced.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.text: We are born in one day. We die in one day. We can change in one day. And we can fall in love in one day. Anything can happen in just one day.
quotes.author: Gayle Forman

quotes.text: You can't live your life thinking death is going to come all the time. You have to live life and if it comes, then we can only hope we were able to do all the things we wanted. He has to want to do something. Everyone does.
quotes.author: Shelena Shorts

quotes.text: Life is a slope. As long as you're going up you're always looking towards the top and you feel happy, but when you reach it, suddenly you can see the road going downhill and death at the end of it all. It's slow going up and quick going down.
quotes.author: Guy de Maupassant

quotes.text: Ah, life's little surprises! They can make any day unforgettable... or make it your last.
quotes.author: T.A. Barron

quotes.text: These are the ushers of Martius: before himHe carries noise, and behind him he leaves tears.Death, that dark spirit, in's nervy arm doth lie,Which being advanc'd, declines, and then men die.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: ...the dead have a way of becoming saints in the eyes of their survivors...
quotes.author: Rachel Vincent

quotes.text: You can't just make me different and then leave
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: Tell him,' the colonel said, smiling, 'that a person doesn't die when he should but when he can.
quotes.author: Gabriel GarcÃƒÂ­a MÃƒÂ¡rquez

quotes.text: The Only Way Out Is To DIE!!!!
quotes.author: Bullet For My Valentine

quotes.text: The sharp knife of a short life, wellI've had, just enough time.
quotes.author: Kimberly Perry

quotes.text: T]hey had killed him. [...] Murdered him, except he would not die. Would not die, he vowed, because he would live to kill his killers.
quotes.author: Michael Punke

quotes.text: You are a hole in my life, a black hole. Anything I place there cannot be returned. I miss you terribly. Ci vedremo lassu, angelo.
quotes.author: Timothy Conigrave

quotes.text: Mist to mist, drops to drops. For water thou art, and unto water shalt thou return.
quotes.author: Kamand Kojouri

quotes.text: If life is worth living for so is it worth dying.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.text: If I lie down on my bed I must be here,But if I lie down in my grave I may be elsewhere.
quotes.author: Stevie Smith

quotes.text: I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: But to mourn, that's different. To mourn is to be eaten alive with homesickness for the person.
quotes.author: Olive Ann Burns

quotes.text: There was something about other people's grief that was so exposing, so personal, that she felt she shouldn't be looking.
quotes.author: Jane Fallon

quotes.text: How we keep these dead souls in our hearts. Each one of us carries within himself his necropolis.
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.text: If after I die, people want to write my biography, there is nothing simpler. They only need two dates: the date of my birth and the date of my death. Between one and another, every day is mine.
quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.text: How does one become butterfly?' Pooh asked pensively.'You must want to fly so much that you are willing to give up being a caterpillar,' Piglet replied.'You mean to die?' asked Pooh.'Yes and no,' he answered. 'What looks like you will die, but what's really you will live on.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.text: Here be dragons to be slain, here be rich rewards to gain;If we perish in the seeking, why, how small a thing is death!
quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quotes.text: Cordelia! stay a little. Ha! What is't thou say'st? Her voice was ever soft.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Only fools insist upon life at any cost.... Others would say that life may be laid down when it becomes too heavy. Where does it go, after all, but into the keeping of the Powers who gave it and will give it once again?
quotes.author: Sheri S. Tepper

quotes.text: It is when we are faced with death that we turn most bookish.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.text: We are all the fools of time and terror: DaysSteal on us and steal from us; yet we live,Loathing our life, and dreading still to die.
quotes.author: Byron

quotes.text: All Bette's stories have happy endings. That's because she knows where to stop. She's realized the real problem with stories'”if you keep them going long enough, they always end in death.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: I think about dying every day, because I can't stop thinking about living.
quotes.author: Libba Bray

quotes.text: Neither of the two people in the room paid any attention to the way I came in, although only one of them was dead.
quotes.author: Raymond Chandler

quotes.text: Before she knew it, she was just another set of eyes in a dusty attic, waiting for the stairs to creak.
quotes.author: Kelly Moran

quotes.text: Yes, Max, you are going to die. Just like everybody else.Thank you, Confucious.
quotes.author: James Patterson

quotes.text: Could I tell them I was sorry their loved one was dead, when he'd tried to kill me? There was no rule of etiquette for this; even my grandmother would have been stymied.
quotes.author: Charlaine Harris

quotes.text: Every cataclysm is welcomed by somebody; there is always someone to rejoice at disaster and see in it the prospect of a new beginning and a better world.
quotes.author: Iain Pears

quotes.text: I will not let her speak because I love her, and when you love someone, you do not make them tell war stories. A war story is a black space. On the one side is before and on the other side is after, and what is inside belongs only to the dead.
quotes.author: Catherynne M. Valente

quotes.text: There really is only one ending to any story. Human life ends in death. Until then, it keeps going and gets complicated and there's loss. Everything involves loss; every relationship ends in one way or another.
quotes.author: Charlie Kaufman

quotes.text: Destiny, if I could sit across the porch from God, I'd thank Him for Lending me you.....
quotes.author: Flavia Weedn

quotes.text: Everybody was dying, or already dead, or leaving other people, and the year was dying into winter, and the only thing to do was make some noise.
quotes.author: Marina Endicott

quotes.text: The lucky ones are just born dead.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: They say, 'The coward dies many times'; so does the beloved. Didn't the eagle find a fresh liver to tear in Prometheus every time it dined?
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The end is in the beginning and yet you go on.
quotes.author: Samuel Beckett

quotes.text: Even death has a heart.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Wayne's a little attached to that hat," Waxillium said. "He thinks it's lucky."Wayne: "It is lucky. I ain't never died while wearing that hat." Marasi frowned. "I ... I'm not sure I know how to respond."Wax: "That's a common reaction to Wayne.
quotes.author: Brandon Sanderson

quotes.text: Everyone's immortal until they're not.
quotes.author: V.E. Schwab

quotes.text: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Eyes, look your last! Arms, take your last embrace! And, lips, oh you the doors of breath, seal with a righteous kiss a dateless bargain to engrossing death!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: It would kill the past, and when that was dead, he would be free.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: You are going to end up as one of those sad old men who poke around in rubbish bins.''œI'm going to end up in a hole in the ground... And so are you. So are we all.
quotes.author: J.M. Coetzee

quotes.text: If death, said my father, reasoning with himself, is nothing but the separation of the soul from the body;--and if it is true that people can walk about and do their business without brains,--then certes the soul does not inhabit there.
quotes.author: Laurence Sterne

quotes.text: It's not reasonable to love people who are only going to die.
quotes.author: Kristin Cashore

quotes.text: Then on your tombstone, where you only get a little bit of space to sum up your life, some wax-faced creep chisels a set of meaningless numbers instead of poetry or a secret love or the name of your favorite candy. In the end, all you get is a few words.
quotes.author: Scott Nicholson

quotes.text: Just being alive should make you late for everything. In case you've never noticed, the dead are always on time.
quotes.author: Arlene Ang

quotes.text: Clown: Good Madonna, why mournest thou?Olivia: Good Fool, for my brother's death.Clown:I think his soul is in hell, Madonna.Olivia:I know his soul is in heaven, Fool.Clown: The more fool, Madonna, to mourn for your brother's soul being in heaven.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: The body's ills are the least of ills, for they end only in death, which is but a little thing. But if the spirit dies, then all is lost.
quotes.author: Michael Flynn

quotes.text: We are mortals all, human and nonhuman, bound in one fellowship of love and travail. No one escapes the fate of death. But we can, with caring, make our good-byes less tormented. If we broaden the circle of our compassion, life can be less cruel.
quotes.author: Gary Kowalski

quotes.text: But all that is warm will go cold. My ears will fall off and my eyes will melt. My mouth will be clamped shut. My lips will turn to glue....No taste or smell or touch or sound.Nothing to look at. Total emptiness for ever.
quotes.author: Jenny Downham

quotes.text: Is that what death would feel like? The nicest, warmest, heaviest never-ending nap? If that's what it's like, I wouldn't mind.
quotes.author: Gayle Forman

quotes.text: I think of death only with tranquility, as an end. I refuse to let death hamper life. Death must enter life only to define it.
quotes.author: JeanPaul Sartre

quotes.text: You'll forget it when you're dead, and so will I. When I'm dead, I'm going to forget everything'“and I advise you to do the same.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: It's easier to die than to move ... at least for the Other Side you don't need trunks.
quotes.author: Wallace Stegner

quotes.text: The man now retrieved a linen cloth and stuffed it deep into Katherine's mouth. 'œDeath,' hewhispered to her, 'œshould be a quiet thing.
quotes.author: Dan Brown

quotes.text: Either we live by accident and die by accident, or we live by plan and die by plan.
quotes.author: Thornton Wilder

quotes.text: Be of good cheer about death, and know this of a truth, that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: The reports of my death are greatly exaggerated.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: I think about death sometimes. Analytically, of course.
quotes.author: Lynne Truss

quotes.text: When the star dies, Its eye closes; tired of watching, It flies back to its first bright dream.
quotes.author: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.text: Right, well, he'd been sick for a while and his nurse said to him, 'You seem to be feeling better this morning,' and Isben looked at her and said, 'On the contrary,' and then he died.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: If Christ taught us anything it is this -- not to let our fear of death keep us from doing the good thing.
quotes.author: Robert Fanney

quotes.text: It's not that we have to quit this life one day, but it's how many things we have to quit all at once: music, laughter, the physics of falling leaves, automobiles, holding hands, the scent of rain, the concept of subway trains... if only one could leave this life slowly!
quotes.author: Roman Payne

quotes.text: Listen: being dead is not worse than being alive. It is different though. You could say the view is larger.
quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.text: Everyone sounded the same when they died.
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.text: Don't call it death; call it moving to Heaven.
quotes.author: Jacob Bowen

quotes.text: How easy to be a bird or an animal, living from day to day, unaware you're alive, unaware that one day you will die.
quotes.author: Rachel Ward

quotes.text: And anyway, it's not as though I'll never see Mum again, is it?
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: On the Death of his ChildDew Evaporates And all our world is dew...so dear, So fresh, so fleeting
quotes.author: Issa

quotes.text: '¦but there they lay, sprawled across the field, craved far more by the vultures than by wives.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.text: He wipes tears off my face and then snot. He uses his hands. He loves me that much.
quotes.author: Nina LaCour

quotes.text: I'm not afraid of death because I don't believe in it.It's just getting out of one car, and into another.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: Are we so made that we have to take death in small doses daily or we could not go on with the business of living?
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: People do not die for us immediately, but remain bathed in a sort of aura oflife which bears no relation to true immortality but through which theycontinue to occupy our thoughts in the same way as when they were alive. Itis as though they were traveling abroad.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.text: That is, Jack thought, the way of life. The horror changes us, because we can never forget. Cursed with memory. It starts when we're old enough to know what death is and realize that sooner or later we'll lose everyone we love. We're never the same. But somehow we're all right. We go on.
quotes.author: Dean Koontz

quotes.text: I have not been able to discover whether there exists a precise French equivalent for the common Anglo-American expression 'killing time.' It's a very crass and breezy expression, when you ponder it for a moment, considering that time, after all, is killing us.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.text: The knowledge of death seemed present in both sisters'”it was something about the way they carried themselves, something that had broken too soon and had not mended, marking them in spite of their lightheartedness.
quotes.author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quotes.text: I believe there are ways whose ends are life instead of death.
quotes.author: William Saroyan

quotes.text: If you don't fear death, then let Kieran meet it.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

quotes.text: Every suicide is a solution to a problem.
quotes.author: Jean Baechler

quotes.text: What are you doing to me?' he asked the crow, tearful. Teaching you how to fly. 'œI can't fly!' You're flying right now. 'œI'm falling!' Every flight begins with a fall, the crow said.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: You must know that I am made of death, from head to foot, and it is a corpse who loves you and adores you and will never, never leave you!
quotes.author: Gaston Leroux

quotes.text: Do you wanna play? Everyone's dead, so I got bored. Did you come to play with me?--Wrath
quotes.author: Hiromu Arakawa

quotes.text: Each of us has his own rhythm of suffering.
quotes.author: Roland Barthes

quotes.text: She had been given a wonderful gift: life. Sometimes it was cruelly taken away too soon, but it's what you did with it that counted, not how long it lasted.
quotes.author: Cecelia Ahern

quotes.text: And thus we all are nighingThe truth we fear to know:Death will end our cryingFor friends that come and go.
quotes.author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quotes.text: I could just remember how my father used to say that the reason for living was to get ready to stay dead a long time.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.text: I saw the years of my life spaced along a road in the form of telephone poles threaded together by wires. I counted one, two, three... nineteen telephone poles, and then the wires dangled into space, and try as I would, I couldn't see a single pole beyond the nineteenth.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all.
quotes.author: William Goodman

quotes.text: The thin line between life and death is still under construction.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.text: Death is a continuation of my life without me...
quotes.author: JeanPaul Sartre

quotes.text: Clearly God was in some kind of mood on my birthday.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death.
quotes.author: William S. Burroughs

quotes.text: With mind distracted, never thinking, "Death is coming,"To slave away on the pointless business of mundane life,And then to come out empty--it is a tragic error. (116)trans by Robert Thurman
quotes.author: Huston Smith

quotes.text: You fear them because you fear death, and rightly: for death is terrible and must be feared,' the mage said...'And life is also a terrible thing,' Ged said, 'and must be feared and praised.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.text: It was Mina this whole time, wasn't it?" I give him the only thing I can: the cold, hard truth. The one that'll rewrite every memory he has - of him and me, her and me, the two of them, all three of us: "It'll always be Mina.
quotes.author: Tess Sharpe

quotes.text: Where death follows, there's life. When darkness surrounds you in a world of chaos, search and you'll eventually find the light.
quotes.author: Lee Argus

quotes.text: Like many people, I feel like celebrating. Remember this feeling. It is human, and can help us understand when others express bloodlust.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: How many times can a heart be shattered and still be pieced back together? How many times before the damage is irreparable?
quotes.author: Gwenn Wright

quotes.text: That kind of imagination is why we're not dead.
quotes.author: Rebecca McKinsey

quotes.text: Those were strange days, now that I look back at them. In the midst of life, everything revolved around death.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: It's odd, isn't it? People die every day and the world goes on like nothing happened. But when it's a person you love, you think everyone should stop and take notice. That they ought to cry and light candles and tell you that you're not alone.
quotes.author: Kristina McMorris

quotes.text: Knowing you are alive is watching on every side your generation's short time falling away as fast as rivers drop through air, and feeling it hit.
quotes.author: Annie Dillard

quotes.text: Our lives carry us along in ways we cannot control, and almost nothing stays with us. It dies when we do, and death is something that happens to us every day.
quotes.author: Paul Auster

quotes.text: Yes, they are carnal, both of them, love and death, and therein lies their terror and their great magic!
quotes.author: Thomas Mann

quotes.text: Death comes for us all, Brother. You cannot hide from it forever. We will die one day, you and I." "And that doesn't frighten you?" Rhy shrugged. "Not nearly as much as the idea of wasting a perfectly good life in fear of it.
quotes.author: V.E. Schwab

quotes.text: to die tomorrow was no worse than dying on any other day. Every day was there to be lived or to mark one's departure from this world.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: Why so much grief for me? No man will hurl me down to Death, against my fate. And fate? No one alive has ever escaped it, neither brave man nor coward, I tell you - it's born with us the day that we are born.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.text: Death is just the last scene of the last act.
quotes.author: Joyce Carol Oates

quotes.text: If Christ is God, He cannot sin, and if suffering was a sin in and by itself, He could not have suffered and died for us. However, since He took the most horrific death to redeem us, He showed us in fact that suffering and pain have great power.
quotes.author: E.A. Bucchianeri

quotes.text: I've told my children that when I die, to release balloons in the sky to celebrate that I graduated. For me, death is a graduation.
quotes.author: Elisabeth KublerRoss

quotes.text: Just as when we come into the world, when we die we are afraid of the unknown. But the fear is something from within us that has nothing to do with reality. Dying is like being born: just a change
quotes.author: Isabel Allende

quotes.text: How obvious can it be? ... The purpose of makeup is to defy the degradations of time, and time is just a synonym for death.
quotes.author: Dean Koontz

quotes.text: I see black light (his last words)
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: My father chose my name , and my last name was chosen by my ancestors . That's enough, I myself choose my way
quotes.author: Ali Shariati

quotes.text: They say that just before you die your whole life flashes before your eyes, but that's not how it happened for me.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver

quotes.text: The dead person is not truly dead until the last person who rememebers them dies.
quotes.author: Sarah Monette

quotes.text: Death, I had discovered long ago, was available in varying flavors, and none of them particularly palatable.
quotes.author: Jasper Fforde

quotes.text: People who get up early in the morning cause war, death and famine.
quotes.author: Banksy

quotes.text: Sleep, those little slices of death '” how I loathe them.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: What is the difference between a living thing and a dead thing? In the medical world, a clinical definition of death is a body that does not change. Change is life. Stagnation is death. If you don't change, you die. It's that simple. It's that scary.
quotes.author: Leonard Sweet

quotes.text: It's okay to talk about it. Death is so normal, I don't know why everyone gets so hung up about it. We all have to deal with it. Most people that you talk to have lost someone, but nobody talks about it.
quotes.author: Rachel Ward

quotes.text: There is a certain seductiveness about dead things. You can ill treat, alter and recolour what's dead. It won't complain.
quotes.author: Jeanette Winterson

quotes.text: Even after somebody dies, you can still keep learning about them.
quotes.author: Jesse Andrews

quotes.text: The scariest thing in the world is thinking someone you love is going to die.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: There was not an inch of solid ground anywhere in the world for me to call my own. I didn't belong anywhere. Had I disappeared, no one would have noticed.
quotes.author: Leigh Hershkovich

quotes.text: Today, however, we are having a hard time living because we are so bent on outwitting death.
quotes.author: Simone de Beauvoir

quotes.text: Only the debris of wreckage, and not much of that, was left behind by the sharks who fed on tragedy: the fishermen, too, mourned the death of a living child.
quotes.author: William Trevor

quotes.text: When you realize that eternity is right here now, that it is within your possibility to experience the eternity of your own truth and being, then you grasp the following: That which you are was never born and will never die. . . . (90)
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: Yet for quixotic reasons--namely, that I enjoyed writing obits--I had decided to scale back on articles about city life in order to write exclusively about the city's dead. For even less money. It was a strange and inexplicable career move.
quotes.author: Avi Steinberg

quotes.text: When writers die they become books, which is, after all, not too bad an incarnation."[As attributed by Alastair Reid in Neruda and Borges, The New Yorker, June 24, 1996; as well as in The Talk of the Town, The New Yorker, July 7, 1986]
quotes.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.text: What do you most value in your friends?Their continued existence.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: who journeyed to Denver, who died in Denver, who came back to Denver & waited in vain, who watched over Denver & brooded and loned in Denver and finally went away to find out the Time, & now Denver is lonesome for her heroes,
quotes.author: Allen Ginsberg

quotes.text: It was not my intention to collapse; no, I would die standing.
quotes.author: Knut Hamsun

quotes.text: Remember, Pia," he whispers. "Perfect is as perfect does.
quotes.author: Jessica Khoury

quotes.text: When I shut my eyes on this world I'll finally have peace.
quotes.author: Kevin Walker

quotes.text: When I die, nieces, I want to be cremated, my ashes taken up in a bush plane and sprinkled onto the people in town below. Let them think my body is snowflakes, sticking in their hair and on their shoulders like dandruff.
quotes.author: Joseph Boyden

quotes.text: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.text: That's it then. This is how it ends. I haven't even read Proust.
quotes.author: James Turner

quotes.text: And here face down beneath the sunAnd here upon earth's noonward heightTo feel the always coming onThe always rising of the night
quotes.author: Archibald MacLeish

quotes.text: Madlen came to sit beside her on the bed. "Lady Queen," she said with her own particular brand of rough gentleness. "It is not the job of the child to protect her mother. It's the mother's job to protect the child. By allowing your mother to protect you, you gave her a gift. Do you understand me?
quotes.author: Kristin Cashore

quotes.text: Someday you will die, and until you know that, you're useless to me.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: Nothing in life was as ugly as death.
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.text: Was. What does was actually mean? The verb to be. Past tense of is. Does it mean that someone is no longer being?
quotes.author: Melina Marchetta

quotes.text: I wish everyone would stop crying, Tom. Uncle Joe would be so angry about it." But she's crying herself now. "He'd be so angry at us, Tom, for crying so much when all he did was laugh.
quotes.author: Melina Marchetta

quotes.text: Walking thru this graveyard, I realize times were never really hard. We live, we love, we let it go. The world ain't changed me at all.
quotes.author: Kevin Dalton  Faubush Hill

quotes.text: It is my wish to die of unique causes, perhaps in a high-speed tricycle crash, a bizarre stapling incient, or as a result of inadvertently sucking my brains out through my ear while trying to untwist the vacuum hose.
quotes.author: Paula Poundstone

quotes.text: Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Hope is a horrible thing, you know. It's a plague. It's like walking around with a fishhook in your mouth and someone just keep pulling it and pulling it."STATE OF WONDER
quotes.author: Ann Patchett

quotes.text: If I could make a dream real, I would not kill anything unless it could never be changed at heart.
quotes.author: Robert Fanney

quotes.text: Your least favorite virtue, or nominee for the most overrated one? Faith. Closely followed'”in view of the overall shortage of time'”by patience.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: I will not tell you our love story, because-like all real love stories-it will die with us,as it should.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: Because there was only one thing worse than dying. And that was knowing you were going to die. And where. And how. ('œDeath Ship')
quotes.author: Richard Matheson

quotes.text: In a world where death is the hunter, my friend, there is no time for regrets or doubts. There is only time for decisions.
quotes.author: Carlos Castaneda

quotes.text: Hope is the great deceiver. Hope is the piper who leads us sleepy to our slaughter.
quotes.author: Brent Weeks

quotes.text: I held her close for only a short time, but after she was gone, I'd see her smile on the face of a perfect stranger and I knew she would be there with me all the rest of my days.

quotes.text: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.

quotes.text: Phaedra of Alonso's death was a never-ending pain that gnawed at his insides. It made him a prisoner in his own cottage.
quotes.author: Melina Marchetta

quotes.text: Her last conscious thought was disgust at life; her senses had lied to her. The world was not made of energy and delight but of foulness, betrayal, and lassitude. Living was hateful, and death was no better, and from end to end of the universe this was the first and last and only truth.
quotes.author: Philip Pullman

quotes.text: After sixty-one years together, she simply clutched my hand and exhaled.
quotes.author: Sara Gruen

quotes.text: He must not merely cling to life, for then he will be a coward, and will not escape. He must not merely wait for death, for then he will be a suicide, and will not escape. He must seek his life in a spirit of furious indifference to it.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: The candle glimmers but an hour. The nightLooms in its ancient hunger. Would you knowThe tragedy of human love and need?Gaze on the stars, then on a brother's face!
quotes.author: George Sterling

quotes.text: Weeping is not the same thing as crying. It takes your whole body to weep, and when it's over, you feel like you don't have any bones left to hold you up.
quotes.author: Sarah Ockler

quotes.text: Pain has a threshold and so does death.
quotes.author: Suzy Kassem

quotes.text: I am still in the land of the dying; I shall be in the land of the living soon. (his last words)
quotes.author: John Newton

quotes.text: Wherever you look there is so much loss and folly to contemplate.
quotes.author: Rosie Thomas

quotes.text: He never sleeps, the judge. He is dancing, dancing. He says that he will never die.
quotes.author: Cormac McCarthy

quotes.text: No crime is a means to an end. No crime can be rationalized.
quotes.author: Compton Gage

quotes.text: I'm sure we all have dreams of leaving at some time in our lives, but when we reach the bottom, most of us go running home.
quotes.author: Deborah Curtis

quotes.text: Too easy to lose the way.Too hard to keep from unraveling when there's nothing to remind you of who youare and where you should be.Another eternity passes in the flick of an eyelash.
quotes.author: Diana Rowland

quotes.text: It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: Sleep: the stepchild of Death.
quotes.author: Nancy A. Collins

quotes.text: The way black women say "girl" can be magical. Frankly, I have no solid beliefs about the survival of consciousness after physical death. But if it's going to happen I know what I want to see after my trek toward the light. I want to see a black woman who will smile and say, "Girl....
quotes.author: Abigail Padgett

quotes.text: I won't be sad too often,If they bury me in the libraryWith bookworms in my coffin.
quotes.author: J. Patrick Lewis

quotes.text: I'd never seen anything like it. First a trial, then a few murders, then dancing. Life goes on. Or, in this case, death continues.
quotes.author: Charlaine Harris

quotes.text: Aunt Rosa, a fussy, angular, wild-eyed old lady, who had lived in a tremulous world of bad news, bankruptcies, train accidents, cancerous growths'”until the Germans put her to death, together with all the people she had worried about.
quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.text: Odd, isn't it? You know when your birthday is, but not your death day, even though you pass the date year after year, never suspecting that some day'¦
quotes.author: Mary Downing Hahn

quotes.text: I am not ready to die,But I am learning to trust deathAs I have trusted life.I am movingToward a new freedom
quotes.author: May Sarton

quotes.text: We have already said more goodbyes than are necessary. Those were goodbyes that brought about the end of partings. We taught each other that no parting is possible.
quotes.author: Donna Goddard

quotes.text: One of the first signs of the beginnings of understanding is the wish to die. This life appears unbearable, another unattainable. One is no longer ashamed of wanting to die; one asks to be moved from the old cell, which one hates, to a new one, which one will only in time come to hate.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: My father told me once that the most important thing every man should know is what he would die for.
quotes.author: Tana French

quotes.text: The amazing miracle of death, when one second you're walking and talking, and the next second you're an object.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: One forgets the dead quite quickly; one doesn't wonder about the dead-what is he doing now, who is he with?
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.text: girlsplease give yourbodies and yourlivestothe young menwhodeserve thembesidesthere isno wayI would welcometheintolerabledullsenseless hellyou would bringmeandI wish youluckin bedandoutbut notinminethankyou.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: Whatever is destroyed, the act of destruction does not vary much. Beauty if vapour from the pit of death.
quotes.author: J. A. Baker

quotes.text: Reproduction is more pleasurable than death.
quotes.author: Herman E. Daly

quotes.text: I'm not courting death; I've far too many books left to read.
quotes.author: Alison Sinclair

quotes.text: Till her appointed course be run;Till on the darkness faint her breathFlown to the silent void, and DeathSit crowned upon the ashen sun.('œThe Testimony of the Suns')
quotes.author: George Sterling

quotes.text: Who but the mad would choose to keep on living? In the end, aren't we all just a little crazy?
quotes.author: Libba Bray

quotes.text: Losing Chloe had been like reading a wonderfulook only to realize that all the pages past a certain point were blank.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: People were excited by violence. What, after all, was the sexual act but a voluntarily endured assault, a momentary death?
quotes.author: P.D. James

quotes.text: Men should think twice before making widowhood women's only path to power.
quotes.author: Gloria Steinem

quotes.text: The cemetery is an open space among the ruins, covered in winter with violets and daisies. It might make one in love with death, to think that one should be buried in so sweet a place.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: Because there is no glory in illness. There is no meaning to it. There is no honor in dying of.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: (On his gravestone): "I told you I was ill".
quotes.author: Spike Milligan

quotes.text: I'm not afraid of being dead. I'm just afraid of what you might have to go through to get there.
quotes.author: Pamela Bone

quotes.text: They had...finished their lives before their death '“ which is not always the end of life and often comes long before the end.
quotes.author: Jules Barbey d'Aurevilly

quotes.text: Death always leaves one singer to mourn.
quotes.author: Katherine Anne Porter

quotes.text: Was it hard? I hope she didn't die hard.'Sethe shook her head. 'Soft as cream. Being alive was the hard part.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.text: Nevertheless, life and death are mysterious states, and we know little of the resources of either.
quotes.author: Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu

quotes.text: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: What am I dying for?
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer

quotes.text: The thought that I might kill myself formed in my mind coolly as a tree or a flower.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Keep your words. This pain is no life." "You only feel pain because you're alive, boy!" the keeper thundered. "This is the mystery of it. Life is lived on the ragged edge of the cliff. Fall off and you might die, but run from it and you are already dead!
quotes.author: Ted Dekker

quotes.text: Thousands of people are being buried and no one attends the funerals,' said one of the soldiers. 'In peacetime it's the other way round: one coffin and a hundred people carrying flowers.
quotes.author: Vasily Grossman

quotes.text: Love doesn't always mean rings and veils and walks down the aisle.Sometimes love means broken windows and broken hearts,and not being able to fix either. And sometimes love means telling you, there's no such thing as time in Heaven so don't rush to meet me. Stay a while, and pick, girl, the roses.
quotes.author: Jennifer Gooch Hummer

quotes.text: To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare one's self to die.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.text: I love you every day. And now I will miss you every day.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom

quotes.text: You can't avoid the inevitability of death. It comes at you one way or another, and takes us all to the same place in the end. To apologize for it is to apologize for the sun shining or the rain falling. It is what it is.
quotes.author: Catherine Doyle

quotes.text: Como siempre, la consideraciÃƒ³n de su muerte lo serenaba tanto como lo turbaba la muerte de los demÃƒ¡s. Tal vez porque, a fin de cuentas, su muerte era el final del mundo.
quotes.author: Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa

quotes.text: All is as if the world did cease to exist. The city's monuments go unseen, its past unheard, and its culture slowly fading in the dismal sea.
quotes.author: Nathan Reese Maher

quotes.text: It's all God's will: you can die in your sleep, and God can spare you in battle.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.text: Her blood is settled, and her joints are stiff;Life and these lips have long been separated:Death lies on her like an untimely frostUpon the sweetest flower of all the field.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: The women in your family have never lost touch with one another. Death is a path we take to meet on the other side.
quotes.author: Edwidge Danticat

quotes.text: Believe me, when you die, it's everybody else's but your problem
quotes.author: Cecelia Ahern

quotes.text: Accepting death doesn't mean you won't be devastated when someone you love dies. It means you will be able to focus on your grief, unburdened by bigger existential questions like, "Why do people die?" and "Why is this happening to me?" Death isn't happening to you. Death is happening to us all.
quotes.author: Caitlin Doughty

quotes.text: Sit," Chloe said, dashing after him and tugging firmly at his sleeve. "Let's hear the rest of it. You can kill him later."~Chloe to Dageus.
quotes.author: Karen Marie Moning

quotes.text: The world is too brutal for me'”I am glad there is such a thing as the grave'”I am sure I shall never have any rest till I get there.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.text: You smell so good,""No, I don't, I smell like death.""You're crazy, you're not dead. You do not smell like death.""I was dead a long time.""And now you're not. Hence the alive smell.
quotes.author: amy tintera

quotes.text: Losing you're co-remember meant losing the memory itself.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.text: We are all dying one by one. We all smell of mortality, and we can't wash it off.
quotes.author: Siri Hustvedt

quotes.text: I was diamond on the outside, and I would not break.Inside, though, I was already broken.
quotes.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

quotes.text: The universe was exploding, each particle away from the next, hurtling us into dark and lonely space, eternally tearing us away from each other - child out of the womb, friend away from friend, moving from each other, each through his own pathway towards the goal-box of solitary death.
quotes.author: Daniel Keyes

quotes.text: Stars," she whispered. "I can see the stars again, my lady."A tear trickled down Artemis's cheek. "Yes, my brave one. They are beautiful tonight."Stars," Zoe repeated. Her eyes fixed on the night sky. And she did not move again.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan

quotes.text: He danced with the sky instead, and the sky dropped him like a rotten plum.
quotes.author: Laini Taylor

quotes.text: This is a long goodbye, yet not time enough. I have no aptitude for this. I cannot learn this. I would hold on, and hold on, until my hands clutch at emptiness.
quotes.author: Juliet Marillier

quotes.text: Death has his favorites, like anyone. Those who are beloved of Death will not die.
quotes.author: Holly Black

quotes.text: The misfortune is that although everyone must come to [death], each experiences the adventure in solitude. We never left Maman during those last days... and yet we were profoundly separated from her.

quotes.text: Death is the force that will create your new life. It is a mechanism of transformation. Welcome it.
quotes.author: Lisa Cach

quotes.text: John: 'Have mercy. I don't want to die!'Sita: 'Then you should never have been born.
quotes.author: Christopher Pike

quotes.text: Time has transfigured them intoUntruth. The stone fidelityThey hardly meant has come to beTheir final blazon, and to proveOur almost-instinct almost true:What will survive of us is love.
quotes.author: Philip Larkin

quotes.text: The night sky is only a sort of carbon paper,Blueblack, with the much-poked periods of starsLetting in the light, peephole after peephole--- A bonewhite light, like death, behind all things.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: If there are no dogs in Heaven, then when I die I want to go where they went.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.text: I wish I could fly like that hawk, rising and falling with the still spaces in the air, far above all this sickness and death and evil.
quotes.author: Heather Day Gilbert

quotes.text: Your coffin reached the monstrous hole. And a part of me went down into the muddy earth with you and lay down next to you and died with you.
quotes.author: Rosamund Lupton

quotes.text: ...every human being is doomed to die, which is the greatest of all failures.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: When his brain died, all of the memoriesheld in his gray matter, along with all of the knowledge he had acquired, would simply evaporatein a flood of chemical reactions.

quotes.text: I said to myself, 'I want to die decently'.
quotes.author: JeanPaul Sartre

quotes.text: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
quotes.author: JK Rowling

quotes.text: If we knew a person was going to die, we'd hold harder to the memories."Fire corrected him, in a whisper. "The good memories.
quotes.author: Kristin Cashore

quotes.text: Death is not the end.
quotes.author: Patrick Ness

quotes.text: Self-destruction would be a brief, almost autoerotic free-fall into a great velvet darkness.
quotes.author: Mark Mirabello

quotes.text: Humans are about to grasp basic substances of all creations. When that moment comes, life or death are no longer matters.
quotes.author: Toba Beta

quotes.text: There are always two deaths, the real one and the one people know about.
quotes.author: Jean Rhys

quotes.text: Charitably... I think... sometimes, perhaps, one must change or die. And, in the end, there were, perhaps, limits to how much he could let himself change.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: If words had weight, a single sentence from Death would have anchored a ship.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: Death is not the worst thing; rather, when one who craves death cannot attain even that wish.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Everybody has got to die, but I have always believed an exception would be made in my case.
quotes.author: William Saroyan

quotes.text: When the dead do walk seek water's run,for this the Dead will always shun. Swift river's best or broadest laketo ward the dead and have and make.If water fails thee, fire's thy friend, if neither guards it will be thy end.
quotes.author: Garth Nix

quotes.text: (Parody that is often falsely believed to be a true quote of Mariah Carey's) Whenever I watch TV and see those poor starving kids all over the world, I can't help but cry. I mean I'd love to be skinny like that but not with all those flies and death and stuff.
quotes.author: Mad Magazine Editors

quotes.text: And we wept that one so lovely should have a life so brief;
quotes.author: William Cullen Bryant

quotes.text: Old age is not as honorable as death, but most people seek it.
quotes.author: David Gemmell

quotes.text: Decline is also a form of voluptuousness, just like growth. Autumn is just as sensual as springtime. There is as much greatness in dying as in procreation.

quotes.text: He thought he saw some horses, too, and a clown, but it was the faces of all those dead raptors that really bothered him. And maybe that clown a little bit.

quotes.text: The battle with the gods thus hinges on our own mortality! Creativity is a yearning for immortality.

quotes.text: We may not get to choose how we die, but we can chose how we live. The universe may forget us, but it doesn't matter. Because we are the ants, and we'll keep marching on.

quotes.text: Erik, Erik! I saved your life! Remember? You were scentenced to death! But for me you would be dead by now.
quotes.author: Gaston Leroux

quotes.text: How did it die?" he asked."Short circuit," I said. "Old and frayed wires."He looked at me like I was senile."Could have been disease. Violence. Or, sometimes, things die because we don't love them enough.
quotes.author: Jonathan Messinger

quotes.text: The human animal is a beast that dies and if he's got money he buys and buys and buys and I think the reason he buys everything he can buy is that in the back of his mind he has the crazy hope that one of his purchases will be life everlasting!--Which it never can be....
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.text: He would reach for me in the middle of the night, nearly every single night, wrapping one of those solid arms around my waist and pulling me in close. So. Close.
quotes.author: Chelsie Shakespeare

quotes.text: Perhaps because it seems so appropriate, I don't notice the rain. It falls in sheets, a blanket of silvery thread rushing to the hard almost-winter ground. Still, I stand without moving at the side of the coffin.
quotes.author: Michelle Zink

quotes.text: All creation necessarily ends in this: Creators, powerless, fleeing from the things they have wrought.
quotes.author: David M. Eagleman

quotes.text: Death is no enemy, but the foundation of gratitude, sympathy, and art. Of all life's pleasures, only love owes no debt to death.
quotes.author: Anita Diamant

quotes.text: Life is a sexually transmitted disease and the mortality rate is one hundred percent.

quotes.text: Please bury me in the library With a dozen long-stemmed proses
quotes.author: J. Patrick Lewis

quotes.text: Without death, life would have no boundaries and our days would not be so precious. My mother was a firm believer in the common sense of nature.
quotes.author: Bernadette Pajer

quotes.text: Live, die, something else lives. The very soil humanity walks upon is built up from death. Digging into a flowerbed means digging into bones.

quotes.text: You're probably wondering what's going to happen to you. That's easy. The same thing is going to happen to you that has happened to every other human being who has ever lived. You're going to die. We all die. That's just how it is.

quotes.text: To be alive, it seemed to me, as I stood there in all kinds of sorrow, was to be both original and reflection, and to be dead was to be split off, to be reflection alone.
