quotes.text: Maybe, as Mizuko said, we won't even really die, just carry on in the feedback loop we are stuck in. Instead of connecting with new things, widening our worlds, algorithms have shrunk it to a narrow chamber with mirrored walls.
quotes.author: Olivia Sudjic

quotes.text: Never underestimate the will of a creature who begins to die at birth.
quotes.author: Lyn Benedict

quotes.text: Death leaves a heartache no one can heal, love leaves a memory no one can steal.From an Irish headstone
quotes.author: Richard Puz

quotes.text: Cine n-ar dori sÃ„ƒ moarÃ„ƒ visÃƒ¢nd cÃ„ƒ moare?
quotes.author: SaÃ…ÂŸa PanÃ„Âƒ

quotes.text: Do you not know that a man is not dead while his name is still spoken?
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: Life is short enough, there is nothing worth here to take your life, and those things we do gain can never be taken to our grave.
quotes.author: Anthony Liccione

quotes.text: Pride and power fall when the person falls, but discoveries of truth form legacies that can be built upon for generations.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.text: Had I truly thought I would not die when he kissed me? But I did. For a moment the breath and life went out of me and there was no time and no tomorrow but only my lips against his.
quotes.author: Martine Leavitt

quotes.text: We took such care of tomorrow, but died on the way there.
quotes.author: Warsan Shire

quotes.text: To escape death, she'd become death.
quotes.author: Sarah J. Maas

quotes.text: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.text: We walk into the rest of our lives together, not knowing it'll end before it's truly started.
quotes.author: Tess Sharpe

quotes.text: As he walked, the sad faded leaves were driven pitilessly around him by the wind, and under the mingling influences of autumn and evening, a craving for the quietude of the grave '¦ overtook him with unwanted intensity.
quotes.author: Georges Rodenbach

quotes.text: I wonder what I will do if she doesn't wake up, and I don't have an answer. As I lie back down next to her and pull her into my arms, my stomach growls, and suddenly I know exactly what I will do. If she doesn't wake up, then I will just lie with her until I don't wake up either.
quotes.author: Shay Savage

quotes.text: What will be left of all the fearing and wanting associated with your problematic life situation that every day takes up most of your attention? A dash, one or two inches long, between the date of birth and date of death on your gravestone.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.text: Once a thing is set to happen, all you can do is hope it won't. Or will-depending. As long as you live, there's always something waiting, and even if it's bad, and you know it's bad, what can you do? You can't stop living.
quotes.author: Truman Capote

quotes.text: When it comes to death, we know that laughter and tears are pretty much the same thing.
quotes.author: Sherman Alexie

quotes.text: That is what death is like. It doesn't matter what uniforms the soldiers are wearing. It doesn't matter how good the weapons are. I thought if everyone could see what I saw, we would never have war anymore.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.text: No one escapes from life alive.
quotes.author: Michael Crichton

quotes.text: For Brutus, as you know, was Caesar's angel:Judge, O you gods, how dearly Caesar loved him!This was the most unkindest cut of all
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: I would request that my body in death be buried not cremated, so that the energy content contained within it gets returned to the earth, so that flora and fauna can dine upon it, just as I have dined upon flora and fauna during my lifetime
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: There would be no chance to get to know death at all ...if it happened only once.
quotes.author: Sogyal Rinpoche

quotes.text: May be able to die those who didn't know how to live
quotes.author: Manuel Maria Barbosa du Bocage

quotes.text: It's your call. You want to go back home, go ahead. But if I were you, I wouldn't. Home is death.
quotes.author: Jeff Abbott

quotes.text: I know who you are and I am ready. Not that I want to go, of course, but I will come." Those souls are always light because more of them have been put out.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.text: Anyway, I'm sort of glad they've got the atomic bomb invented. If there's ever another war, I'm going to sit right the hell on top of it. I'll volunteer for it, I swear to God I will.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.text: The young open the paper to forget about life by reading the funny strips. The old do it to forget about death by reading other people's obits. My advice: don't open the paper and go on with your life.
quotes.author: Gabriel BÃƒÂ¡

quotes.text: A tomb now suffices him for whom the world was not enough.[Alexander's tombstone epitaph]
quotes.author: Alexander the Great

quotes.text: I thought of the people before me who had looked down at the river and gone to sleep beneath it. I wondered about them. I wondered how they had done it--it, the physical act.I simply wondered about the dead because their days had ended and I did not know how I would get through mine.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.text: true apothecary thy drugs art quick
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Adam pressed his hand to his face. Sighed. "Right. It's just that'¦ He died. And I'm so freaking pissed off, I swear I'd punch him in the face if he were standing right here.
quotes.author: Kristina McBride

quotes.text: ...When you die, the energy that kept you alive filters into the people you loved. Did you know that? It's like a fire you've tended all your life, and the sparks are all scattered into the wind.... That's why we survive as long as we do, because the people who loved us keep us going.
quotes.author: Kevin Brockmeier

quotes.text: I see a brightportionunder the overhead lightthat shades intodarknessand then into darkerdarknessand I can't see beyond that.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: It's better to die laughing than to live each moment in fear.
quotes.author: Michael Crichton

quotes.text: It's natural to die. The fact that we make such a big hullabaloo over it is all because we don't see ourselves as part of nature. We think because we're human we're something above nature.
quotes.author: Morrie Schwartz

quotes.text: In ten years time I'll be'¦ (dead) sixty.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: I just want to die knowing that I've made a difference in the world... or at least a difference to someone, no matter how small the difference.
quotes.author: Eloise Dyson
